0.title: Cong leader criticises Delhi Police's food for detained workers, shares video
0.article_body: Congress leader Manickam Tagore on Tuesday criticised food provided by the Delhi Police to party leaders detained for protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi. A video shared by him showed 'poori' and 'sabji' kept in two containers. He later shared another video of food provided by Delhi Congress chief Anil Chaudhary.

1.title: It's an investigative drama, I play a crime beat journalist: Yami on 'Lost'
1.article_body: Speaking about her upcoming film 'Lost', Yami Gautam said it's an investigative drama. "Tony da’s (Aniruddha) world you can imagine in a film like this, with a...realistic tone, a lot of human drama," she said. "I play a crime beat journalist in it and in its own subtle way it touches about media integrity in today’s time," she added.

2.title: Love is blind, stronger than love of parents & society: K'taka HC
2.article_body: The Karnataka High Court, while allowing a girl who eloped and married her lover to stay with him, said that the case depicted that love is blind, stronger than the love of parents and family members. "What they are doing to their parents today, they will get back exactly tomorrow," the court added.

3.title: PM Modi launches special stamp to mark 200th anniversary of Mumbai Samachar
3.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday released a special postal stamp commemorating the 200 years of the Mumbai Samachar newspaper. While addressing a gathering, PM Modi said, "Under the influence of foreigners, when this city became Bombay, even then this newspaper didn't leave its local connect." He added that regional newspapers played an important role in the Independence struggle.

4.title: J&K DGP reviews security arrangements ahead of Amarnath Yatra
4.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) Director General of Police (DGP) Dilbag Singh on Tuesday chaired a high-level meeting of senior officers from Police, Civil administration and CAPFs ahead of the upcoming Amarnath Yatra. He reviewed the security arrangements and deployment of personnel for the yatra. Notably, the Amarnath Yatra will begin on June 30 and conclude after 43 days.

5.title: Pak to suffer like Sri Lanka if fuel subsidies not lifted: Minister
5.article_body: Pakistan Finance Minister Miftah Ismail said that the country's economy will default and suffer consequences like crisis-hit Sri Lanka if the government doesn't lift fuel subsidies. Ismail stated that the government was still providing a subsidy of PKR 19 on petrol and PKR 53 on diesel. The IMF won't sign deal with Pakistan if fuel prices aren't increased, he added.

6.title: WhatsApp allows users to transfer chat history from Android to iPhone
6.article_body: WhatsApp will now allow users to transfer their chat history, photos, videos, and voice messages from Android to iPhone, Mark Zuckerberg announced on Tuesday. "This is a top requested feature," the CEO of WhatsApp parent Meta Platforms said. Android users will be able to transfer their WhatsApp data to iPhone using Apple's 'Move to iOS' app, while maintaining end-to-end encryption.

7.title: Shirtless man climbs atop moving police car, breaks windshield in Hyd; video viral
7.article_body: A shirtless man, who was reportedly drunk, climbed atop a moving police vehicle in Hyderabad, a video of which is being widely shared online. He damaged the rear windshield of the patrol car, police said. A policeman reportedly thrashed the man with a plastic baton once he got down from the vehicle.

8.title: Red alert in Assam, Meghalaya for heavy rainfall over next 2 days: IMD
8.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday issued a red alert for heavy rainfall over most places in Assam and Meghalaya from June 15-16. An orange alert has been issued for the two states from Jun 17-18. IMD has also issued an orange alert for Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura till June 18 and for Arunachal Pradesh till June 17.

9.title: IPL becomes 2nd most valued sporting league as media rights sold for ₹48,390 crore
9.article_body: IPL overtook English Premier League to become the second-most valued sporting league in terms of per match value after its media rights were sold for ₹48,390 crore. IPL's TV rights (Package A) were bagged by Star India for ₹23,575 crore, amounting to ₹57.5 crore/match. Meanwhile, Viacom18 bagged digital rights (Package B and C) for ₹23,758 crore, amounting to ₹57.9 crore/match.

10.title: Kriti, Kartik, Farah remember Sushant on his 2nd death anniversary
10.article_body: Bollywood celebrities like Kriti Sanon, Kartik Aaryan and Farah Khan took to social media to remember late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his second death anniversary. Kriti shared a heart emoji with the song 'Darasal' from their 2017 film 'Raabta'. Kartik shared a picture of Sushant, writing in the caption, "Stars always shine no matter where they are."

11.title: Prime goal is to win two World Cups in next 18 months: Babar Azam
11.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said he'll consider his runs "worth gold" if he's able to achieve the prime goal of winning the two World Cups (T20 and ODI) for the side in next 18 months. Pakistan won T20 World Cup in 2009 under Younis Khan, while they won ODI World Cup in 1992 under their former Prime Minister Imran Khan.

12.title: Kyrgios only other player than Djokovic who can beat everyone on grass: Todd
12.article_body: Ex-Australia tennis player Todd Woodbridge has said if there is any player besides Novak Djokovic who can play well enough and beat everyone on grass, it's compatriot Nick Kyrgios. "He is a legitimate force and has a chance to go deep at Wimbledon," he added. Kyrgios best result at Wimbledon came in 2014, when he reached the quarter-finals.

13.title: My mom cried when she saw 48% in my prelim SSC result: Shilpa
13.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty has revealed that her mother producer Sunanda Shetty cried when she saw her SSC prelims report in which she had scored 48%. "My mom...bawled for the first time. She said you're going to be absolutely useless, worthless and nikammi," Shilpa added. The actress said that she then studied well for 10 days and scored a decent percentage.

14.title: He's busy with other issues: Thakur on Rahul's 'maha jumla' remark
14.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for calling Centre's announcement of recruitment of 10 lakh people in 18 months as "maha jumla". "Rather than welcoming the decision, he is too busy dealing with other issues to show his happiness towards this," Thakur said. "This is a government of not 'jumlas', but 'maha jumlas'," Rahul Gandhi tweeted earlier.

15.title: 3 brothers threaten to blow up district court in UP, arrested
15.article_body: Three brothers were arrested for threatening to blow up the UP district court premises and an armed police force deployed there, police said on Tuesday. SP Chakresh Mishra said that the three brothers, who were working as labourers, were in an inebriated state when they made the threat call. The trio regularly made such calls after consuming alcohol, he said.

16.title: Mumbai logs 1,724 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths; positivity rate rises to 15.58%
16.article_body: Mumbai has reported 1,724 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1,240 recoveries and two deaths in the last 24 hours. The city's positivity rate on Tuesday has increased to 15.58%, compared to Monday's 11.6%. The number of active cases in Mumbai stands at 11,813. The overall growth rate of COVID-19 cases in the city between June 7 and 13 was 0.149%.

17.title: Mumbai woman kills self, husband booked for abetment to suicide
17.article_body: The Bhandup police registered a case of abetment to suicide against a 28-year-old man for allegedly assaulting and harassing his 24-year-old wife, who died by suicide. The two got married in August 2020 without informing anyone, the police said. After a few months, there were regular arguments between them, during which the 28-year-old would manhandle the woman, police added.

18.title: PWD engineer arrested for accepting ₹40,000 bribe in MP's Bhopal
18.article_body: The Lokayukta Police arrested an executive engineer of Madhya Pradesh's Public Works Department (PWD) for accepting a bribe of ₹40,000 in Bhopal, an official said. A Rajgarh-based contractor had complained that the accused demanded ₹1 lakh "commission" for releasing security deposit kept against a contract work, police said. A case was registered under Prevention of Corruption Act, police added.

19.title: Drugs worth ₹8 lakh seized in Gujarat's Vadodara, 4 arrested
19.article_body: Police arrested four people in Gujarat's Vadodara and seized 81.04 gram of mephedrone drug worth ₹8 lakh, which they had allegedly procured from Madhya Pradesh, officials said. Vadodara Police's Special Operations Group (SOG) said the four accused, including a woman from Maharashtra, are part of the "Bichchhu Gang". With this, the police claimed to have busted an inter-state drug racket.

20.title: Flood control cell set up in Faridabad to monitor waterlogging
20.article_body: Ahead of the monsoon season, a flood control cell has been set up to deal with waterlogging in Faridabad, the city's Deputy Commissioner Jitender Yadav said. He also directed officials to ensure that all the cleaning works are completed before the monsoon season. Yadav said that over 100 civil defence volunteers will be roped in to assist the police.

21.title: 2 Mumbai men get 20 years in prison for minor's gangrape in 2017
21.article_body: A Special Mumbai court sentenced two men, Kiran Gaikwad and Ajay Waghmare, to 20 years of imprisonment for gangraping a minor in 2017. One of them had sexually assaulted the girl, while the other filmed the act. The court sentenced third accused Salim Ansari to three years in jail for harassing the girl by threatening to release the video.

22.title: South Africa to bowl first against India in third T20I, both sides unchanged
22.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in third T20I in Visakhapatnam. Both the playing XIs are unchanged. India stand-in captain Rishabh Pant mentioned that he would also have bowled first had he won the toss. South Africa lead the five-match series 2-0 after having won the T20Is in Delhi and Cuttack.

23.title: No DJs during Kanwar Yatra in Rajasthan: State Chief Secretary
23.article_body: The Rajasthan government has disallowed the use of DJs during the Kanwar Yatra held in the state. According to the state government, vehicles with DJs mounted on them will be confiscated by police. State Chief Secretary Usha Sharma, while announcing the decision, asked police officers to emphasise coordination with people to avoid communal incidents.

24.title: President Kovind attends 'Lokarpana' of ISKCON temple in B'luru
24.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday attended the 'Lokarpana' of ISKCON Sri Rajadhiraja Govinda Temple in Bengaluru on Tuesday. According to ISKCON (International Society for Krishna Consciousness), Sri Rajadhiraja Govinda Temple on Kanakapura Road is a traditional, stone-carved structure and a replica of the famous Sri Venkateswara temple in Andhra Pradesh.

25.title: Not letting Ajit Pawar speak at PM's event is Maha's insult: Sule
25.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Supriya Sule on Tuesday said that not letting Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar speak at inauguration of Pune's Sant Tukaram Shila temple is an insult to the state. "A request was made to the PMO to allow [Pawar] to speak, but [there was no response]," Sule added. PM Narendra Modi attended the ceremony earlier today.

26.title: Thieves steal gold, diamond jewellery worth ₹4 cr in Mumbai, arrested
26.article_body: Police on Tuesday said three persons have been arrested for allegedly stealing gold and diamond jewellery worth ₹4 crore from a rented premises in south Mumbai. Deepak Jain, the complainant, claimed that his father "appeared in his dream", asking him to visit the room and collect the "treasure". Jain did not find the jewellery when he reached the room.

27.title: Cabinet approves development of Greenfield Airport in Guj's Dholera
27.article_body: Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved the development of Phase I of Greenfield Airport in Gujarat's Dholera. Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that 1,501 hectares of land have been allocated for the airport which'll be built within 48 months. It's expected to handle 2,73,000 tonne cargo and cater to 23 lakh passengers in the next 20 years, he added.

28.title: Still unclear what problem audience had: Chandraprakash on 'Samrat...' failure
28.article_body: Speaking about Samrat Prithviraj's poor performance at the box office, filmmaker Chandrapraksh Dwivedi said that he failed to understand what problem the audience had. "YRF presented this story at a huge scale. But people had a problem. It’s still unclear to me what problem they had," he said. "The writers did an honest job of following...historical facts," Chandraprakash added.

29.title: Pakistan creating communal tension to disturb peace in J&K: BJP
29.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir BJP chief Ravinder Raina on Tuesday said that Pakistan hatched a conspiracy in the form of targeted killings and dividing people on religious lines to disturb peace in the union territory. "The people of Jammu and Kashmir are desirous of peace as they have seen enough of Pakistan-sponsored terrorism," he said.

30.title: Star India wins IPL TV rights for ₹23,575 cr, Viacom18 bags digital rights for ₹23,758 cr
30.article_body: Star India has acquired IPL's TV rights for the next five years (2023-2027 cycle) for a record ₹23,575 crore, while Reliance-led Viacom18 bagged the digital rights for ₹23,758 crore. Notably, Sony held the media rights for the first 10 years of IPL for about ₹8,200 crore, while Star India held the rights for 2018 to 2022 cycle for ₹16,347 crore.

31.title: Tiwary told 'If you impress Kohli, you'll play IPL': RCB's Akash Deep
31.article_body: RCB pacer Akash Deep has revealed how he was selected to play in IPL. "Manoj Tiwary bhaiya said, 'Virat Kohli is India's captain and if you manage to impress him, you will get to play in the IPL next season and might play for India as well,'" said Akash Deep. The 25-year-old played five matches for RCB in IPL 2022.

32.title: 25-yr-old Delhi man kills his wife for refusing to cook for him
32.article_body: A 25-year-old man allegedly stabbed his 28-year-old wife to death because she refused to cook for him after an argument, in Delhi's Neb Sarai locality on Monday. Deputy Commissioner of Police (south) Benita Mary Jaiker said the suspect, Dharmender, works as a cleaner at a restaurant. The suspect is absconding and efforts are being made to arrest him, she added.

33.title: Pune's Ruby Hall Clinic allowed to resume live organ transplants
33.article_body: The Maharashtra health department has passed an order allowing the Ruby Hall Clinic in Pune to resume live organ transplants, months after the hospital's organ transplant registration was suspended. The hospital will have to set up a fresh committee to monitor organ transplants, as per an official order. A kidney swap transplant case was reported at the hospital recently.

34.title: Nutraj Bactopure announces India's 1st pathogen-free* dry fruit & nuts
34.article_body: Dry fruits and nuts may contain harmful bacteria, causing diseases like cholera and typhoid, said Nutraj, revealing that its Nutraj Bactopure- dry fruits & nuts range uses German technology to kill harmful bacteria from the product. It provides "certificate of purity" from government-approved laboratory which can be verified by scanning the QR Code provided on each pack, the brand added.

35.title: Deepika rushed to hospital after increased heart rate, returns to sets: Report
35.article_body: Deepika Padukone, who's in Hyderabad shooting for her film 'Project K', was rushed to a private hospital as she felt unwell after her heart rate increased, as per reports. She was immediately taken to Kamineni Hospital in the city where the doctors examined her, reports added. Soon after treatment, Deepika reportedly returned to the sets as her heart rate stabilised.

36.title: Bengal Assembly passes bill to remove Guv as Visitor of pvt universities
36.article_body: The West Bengal Assembly on Tuesday passed a bill to replace Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar with the state Education Minister Bratya Basu as the Visitor of private universities. This comes after the Assembly passed a bill seeking to replace Dhankhar with CM Mamata Banerjee as the state-run universities' Chancellor. Both the bills need to get consent from Dhankhar before becoming acts.

37.title: Google announces startup accelerator programme for women in India
37.article_body: Google has announced the launch of 'Google for Startups Accelerator India: Women Founders', an accelerator programme specially for women entrepreneurs in India. The programme's inaugural batch will accept up to 20 women-founded/co-founded startups in India and support them through a three-month programme. Its curriculum will include workshops and support around product strategy and growth.

38.title: Pune Police book 36 people for gambling, seize ₹6.80 lakh cash
38.article_body: Pune Police on Saturday raided a gambling den in the city's Mangalwar Peth area and booked 36 persons under relevant sections of the anti-gambling act. An estimated ₹6.80 lakh cash was also seized from the accused, who were nabbed from the parking lot of a residential building in the area. The main accused, identified as Bhimashankar, has been arrested.

39.title: Oil crosses $123 mark as tight supply counters recession worries
39.article_body: Oil price crossed the $123 mark on Tuesday as tight global supply overpowered worries that fuel demand would be hit by a possible recession and fresh COVID-19 curbs in China. While Brent crude rose 94 cents to $123.21/barrel, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) rose 79 cents to $121.72/barrel. Tight supply has been aggravated by a drop in exports from Libya.

40.title: PM Modi arrives in Mumbai, attends event with Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray
40.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated the Jal Bhushan Building and Gallery of Revolutionaries at the Raj Bhavan in Mumbai. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray was also present at the programme. PM Modi was received by Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari, Thackeray, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar and Protocol Minister Aaditya Thackeray at the INS Shikra heliport.

41.title: Coinbase fires 1,100 employees, CEO says 'we appear to be entering recession'
41.article_body: Coinbase is laying off 18% of its workforce, or about 1,100 employees citing "economic downturn", amid a collapse in its stock and crypto prices. The crypto exchange's CEO Brian Armstrong told employees, "We appear to be entering a recession after a 10+ year economic boom." Earlier this month, Coinbase extended its hiring freeze and rescinded a number of accepted offers.

42.title: College of Engineering Pune tops AICTE's learning assessment survey
42.article_body: College of Engineering Pune has been ranked first in All India Council for Technical Education's (AICTE) learning assessment survey, with 314 undergraduates scoring over 70% in the test. Jharkhand's Birsa Institute of Technology and Karnataka's NMAM Institute of Technology ranked second and third. The three colleges don't fall in National Institute Ranking Framework's list of top 50 colleges.

43.title: Mamata meets Sharad Pawar ahead of Oppn's meet on Presidential poll
43.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday met NCP chief Sharad Pawar at his residence in Delhi ahead of the Opposition's meeting to discuss the Presidential election to be held next month. Banerjee last week wrote to leaders of 22 opposition parties for the meeting. The Opposition's meeting is scheduled for June 15 (Wednesday).

44.title: Kevin Spacey to face London court over 4 counts of sexual assault
44.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has been formally charged with four counts of sexual assault against three men and is expected to appear in a London court on Thursday. UK's Crown Prosecution Service (CPS) has authorised the charges against the actor. One of the charges is from March 2005, two others are dated August 2008 and the fourth is from April 2013.

45.title: Ring up Dhoni or talk to Rahul: Hogg to Pant after India's 2 losses vs SA
45.article_body: Following Rishabh Pant-led India's two losses in first two T20Is against South Africa in ongoing five-match series, Brad Hogg said the India captain needs to be more decisive and take control in the middle. "If he needs to learn anything, he can ring up MS Dhoni or talk to KL Rahul," he added. Third T20I will be played on Tuesday.

46.title: Police arrest 2 aides of Lawrence Bishnoi, Goldy Brar in Mohali
46.article_body: The Mohali Police and Anti-Gangster Task Force on Tuesday arrested two active members of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang and Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar, officials said. SSP Vivek Sheel Soni said that the accused had been in touch with Goldy Brar through another gangster Manpreet Singh, who provided a car to the assailants involved in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case.

47.title: I'll repay all my loans & eat to my heart's content: Kamal Haasan on Vikram's success
47.article_body: Kamal Haasan, speaking about the success of his film 'Vikram', said, "When I said 'I can earn ₹300 crore in a snap', nobody understood...They thought I was beating my chest. You can see now it's coming." "I'll repay all my loans, I'll eat to my heart's content and I'll give whatever I can to my family and friends," he added.

48.title: Delhi reports 1,118 fresh cases of COVID-19, 82% more than yesterday
48.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported 1,118 fresh COVID-19 cases, which is 82% more than Monday's 614 cases. The national capital also reported two coronavirus-related deaths on Tuesday, while 500 people recovered from the infection. The city has recorded a case positivity rate of 6.5%. As many as 1,910 patients are under home isolation and 149 are undergoing treatment at hospitals.

49.title: NordVPN to remove servers in India amid govt order to store user data
49.article_body: NordVPN said it is "no longer able to keep servers in India" after the government's CERT-In introduced new rules requiring VPN service providers to collect and store user data for at least five years. NordVPN will remove its servers on June 26, a day before the new rules come into force. Earlier, Surfshark and ExpressVPN announced shutting down India servers.

50.title: They banned my name: Lalit Modi to man saying BCCI should thank him over IPL media rights
50.article_body: With IPL media rights reportedly fetching over ₹44,000 crore in e-auction, a man on Twitter said BCCI should thank ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi. Lalit replied, "They even banned my name...This is the fear they have as they did nothing to establish it...Reap the money. It doesn't bother me...But they can’t take away the fact I created it...That’s enough for me."

51.title: Punjab Police allowed to formally arrest Lawrence Bishnoi in Moosewala murder case
51.article_body: A Delhi court on Tuesday allowed Punjab Police to formally arrest gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, an accused in Sidhu Moosewala murder case. Lawrence Bishnoi's lawyer had opposed Punjab Police's plea, stating that they have apprehension that Lawrence Bishnoi may be killed in a fake encounter in Punjab. The gangster was earlier lodged in Tihar jail in Delhi.

52.title: 2 Telangana BJP leaders arrested in Hyd over skit against CM KCR
52.article_body: Telangana BJP leaders Rani Rudrama and Daruvu Yellanna have been arrested in Hyderabad for allegedly enacting a skit defaming CM K Chandrashekar Rao. A notice has been served to state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay to appear before police for questioning in this connection. The skit was enacted on Telangana Formation Day on June 2.

53.title: Construction of cable-stayed bridge in Rajasthan complete, pic released
53.article_body: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari has announced that the project for the construction and maintenance of a cable-stayed bridge across river Chambal on Rajasthan's Kota Bypass has been completed. Gadkari added that the 1.4-km-long bridge, built with a capital expenditure worth ₹214 crore, is capable of tackling extreme traffic situations and handling heavy rainfall and winds.

54.title: 70 Afghan couples marry at mass wedding ceremony in Kabul
54.article_body: As many as 70 Afghan couples got married in Kabul at a mass wedding ceremony on Monday in presence of Taliban fighters, reports have stated. A local NGO reportedly organised the ceremony as the couples were unable to make their respective arrangements due to financial constraints. "I have no job. We were short of money," a 22-year-old bridegroom told reporters.

55.title: Things were worse for women earlier: H'wood actress Constance Marie
55.article_body: Hollywood actress Constance Marie has stated in an interview that things were worse for women in the industry "back in the day". She added that women were not offered lead parts of any projects and were always the thing that needed to be rescued. "Like we couldn't even [do anything]...You are always [standing there]," the actress added.

56.title: Was laughing for show, traumatic time: Archana on news of mom-in-law's death
56.article_body: Archana Puran Singh recalled a "traumatic" event which occurred during her stint on 'Comedy Circus'. She revealed that she came to know about her mother-in-law's death in the middle of an episode. "The production house asked me to give...reactions and go. Reactions were laughter...I still can't forget I was sitting there laughing...All I could think of was...my mother-in-law," she added.

57.title: 5-time winner Murray withdraws from Queen's Club Championships due to injury
57.article_body: Five-time champion Andy Murray has been forced to withdraw from the Queen's Club Championships in London due to an abdominal injury, the tournament's organisers said on Monday. The ex-world number one suffered the injury during Sunday's Boss Open final loss to Italian Matteo Berrettini in Stuttgart. Murray last won a title on grass at Wimbledon in 2016.

58.title: People said Pak couldn't chase 350, we did it against Australia: Azam
58.article_body: Talking about his team, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said, "People said we couldn't chase 350. We did [that against Australia in April 2022]." "We talked about how we needed to play different cricket," added Azam. Azam stated his team still needs to improve in certain areas, highlighting losing wickets in clusters and the need for better concentration from his players.

59.title: Mumbai to witness 6 of upcoming monsoon's 22 high tides this week
59.article_body: Of the 22 high tides predicted to hit Mumbai this monsoon, six will occur this week alone, according to the Disaster Management Cell. The six tides will be around 4.5 metres high and if Mumbai witnesses high rainfall on the day of the tides, there could be episodes of heavy inundation. BMC has already deployed personnel on Mumbai's six beaches.

60.title: Anand Mahindra, retired IIM professor Dholakia & 2 others to join RBI board
60.article_body: The central government has appointed Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra and three others as non-official Directors on the Central Board of Reserve Bank of India. Apart from Mahindra, others are Dr Ravindra H Dholakia, an IIM Ahmedabad retired professor, Venu Srinivasan, Chairman Emeritus TVS Motor Company and Pankaj R Patel, Chairman at Zydus Lifesciences Limited.

61.title: Best time I've ever had at the movies: Captain America writer praises 'RRR'
61.article_body: Jackson Lanzing, who has worked on comic book titles like Batman Beyond and Captain America, took to Twitter to praise Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR'. He wrote, "Hey Jackson, was RRR the best time you've ever had at...movies?" followed by a GIF of Charan giving a thumbs up. Earlier, 'Doctor Strange' writer C Robert Cargill also praised the film.

62.title: I was just numb, gobsmacked: Rio Ferdinand on Manchester United exit
62.article_body: Former Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said he was just "numb" and "gobsmacked" on being informed about Manchester United's decision to not renew his contract, resulting in Ferdinand's exit from the club in 2014. "[It would be] mind-boggling if they let [Ryan Giggs, Patrice Evra, Nemanja Vidic and me]...go, I couldn't see it...and then we all went!" added Ferdinand.

63.title: Cong acting like Sonia, Rahul Gandhi never do any wrong: K'taka Minister
63.article_body: Karnataka Minister R Ashoka on Tuesday said Congress is acting like party leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi "can never do any wrong and whatever they do is right". Congress is trying to subvert the Indian Constitution by shielding Sonia and Rahul in the National Herald case, the BJP leader said. Congress is carrying out "protest drama", Ashoka added.

64.title: Administrator at Srei finds over ₹3,000 cr in fraudulent transactions
64.article_body: The RBI-appointed administrator at Srei Equipment Finance Ltd has found fraudulent transactions worth over ₹3,000 crore conducted over FY20 and FY21. Loans involved with these transactions were at ₹2,512 crore, while the notional loss to the company stood at ₹513.67 crore, the company's filing said. The administrator has filed an application with the National Company Law Tribunal in this regard.

65.title: Video shows K'taka CM crying after watching 777 Charlie; says 'reminded me of my late dog'
65.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai broke down into tears after watching the film '777 Charlie' and said that it reminded him of his pet dog Snooby that passed away last year. "I keep talking about unconditional love. A dog's love is unconditional love, which is pure," CM Bommai told reporters.

66.title: Seeing my parents jump with joy meant the world to me: Manushi on debut film
66.article_body: Speaking about her parents' reaction after watching her film 'Samrat Prithviraj', former Miss World Manushi Chhillar said, "My parents have always been...supportive of my decisions and I wanted them to enjoy watching me on screen." "To see them jump with joy...and listen to how they felt I was good in my debut film, meant the world to me," she added.

67.title: I only agreed to do 'Sam Bahadur' because of Meghna Gulzar: Fatima
67.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh, who will be portraying former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in Vicky Kaushal-starrer 'Sam Bahadur', revealed that she only agreed to do the movie because of filmmaker Meghna Gulzar. The actress further said that she gave only one look-test for the film. Fatima had said in an earlier interview that working with Meghna is a personal milestone.

68.title: Newlyweds Nayanthara, Vignesh visit temple in Kerala, pics surface
68.article_body: Newlywed couple Nayanthara and director Vignesh Shivan visited Kerala's Chettikulangara Devi temple, where they performed a puja. In the pictures that have surfaced online, Nayanthara could be seen in a floral ethnic suit and Vignesh in a traditional mundu. The couple earlier visited Tirupati temple. Nayanthara and Vignesh got married on June 9 in Mahabalipuram.

69.title: Have discussed about taking stance on human rights issues in Qatar: Harry Kane
69.article_body: England's Harry Kane said that he has discussed with France's Hugo Lloris and Denmark's Christian Eriksen about taking a collective stance on human rights issues surrounding this year's football World Cup in Qatar. "When we come to a decision...for sure we will share it," Kane said. Recently, a report alleged that thousands of migrant workers in Qatar were being exploited.

70.title: Political witch-hunt: TMC as CBI questions Abhishek's wife in coal scam
70.article_body: TMC on Tuesday accused the Centre of engaging in a "political witch-hunt" after a CBI team questioned West Bengal MP Abhishek Banerjee's wife Rujira in connection with the coal scam. "Minutes after our National General Secretary...lands in Agartala, 'remote controlled' CBI springs into action," TMC tweeted. Notably, CBI had interrogated Rujira last year ahead of the state assembly elections.

71.title: Ex-U'khand AAP chief Deepak Bali joins BJP after quitting party
71.article_body: Former Uttarakhand Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Deepak Bali on Tuesday joined the Bharatiya Janata Party a day after resigning from his post and membership of AAP. Bali joined the BJP in the presence of Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami. In a letter, Bali had cited being "uncomfortable with the party's methodology" as a reason for his resignation from AAP.

72.title: ₹2,366 cr power bills pending against govt departments: Punjab power body
72.article_body: According to Punjab State Electricity Board Engineers' Association, the state's government departments are the major defaulters of electricity bills. Reports said that power bills worth ₹2,366 crore are pending against them as of April 2022. Subsidy bills of ₹9,000 crore are also pending against the Punjab government as of date, the association reportedly added.

73.title: German howitzers soon to be ready for use in Ukraine: Defence Min
73.article_body: Germany's Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said that Ukrainian troops receiving training on using German howitzers would soon complete their exercise and therefore be able to use the weapons in the war in Ukraine. The Panzerhaubitze 2000 is one of the most powerful artillery weapons in the German army's inventories. It can hit targets at a distance of 40 kilometres.

74.title: 4 JD(U) leaders suspended from party on disciplinary grounds
74.article_body: Four leaders of Janata Dal (United) were suspended from the primary membership of the party on Tuesday on disciplinary grounds. These include Anil Kumar, Bipin Kumar Yadav, Ajay Alok and Jitendra Neeraj. "They were running a parallel programme contrary to the party's ideology and were misguiding party workers despite holding important positions," said Bihar JD(U) chief Umesh Kushwaha.

75.title: Understand the chronology: Surjewala as wholesale inflation rises
75.article_body: As India’s WPI surged to a record high of 15.88% in May, Congress’ Randeep Singh Surjewala said that ED’s notice is served to people who raise their voices against inflation. "Understand the chronology-Issue a notice of ED to the voices raised against inflation so that the attention is diverted under the guise of ED's probe," Surjewala tweeted.

76.title: Google Maps launches new feature to estimate toll charges on a route
76.article_body: Google Maps has launched a new feature that will estimate the amount that a user has to pay in tolls on their selected route. The feature has been enabled on Android and iOS apps for users in the US, India, Japan, and Indonesia. Previously, the app would alert users about an upcoming toll but didn't calculate its amount.

77.title: Amarnath Yatra pilgrims told to undergo Aadhaar Authentication voluntarily
77.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government has released a notification, asking pilgrims planning to undertake the Amarnath Yatra to furnish proof of possession of Aadhaar or undergo Aadhaar Authentication on a voluntary basis. According to officials, the decision has been taken as part of measures to tighten security, amid threats from terrorist groups across the border to disrupt the yatra.

78.title: Akshay told me if 'Samrat...' fails, he'll go back to 'Rowdy...': Maker
78.article_body: Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, the director of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', said Akshay told him that he will go back to working in movies like 'Rowdy Rathore' and films from the 'Housefull' franchise if 'Samrat Prithviraj' fails. "[Those] films pay me more...People want to watch things which have no controversies.Then that's what I will do," added Dwivedi sharing what Akshay said.

79.title: After almost a year, Olympic champion Neeraj to return to action tonight
79.article_body: After staying away from the athletic field for almost a year, Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra is set to return to action at the Paavo Nurmi Games in Finland tonight. "It's a pleasure to have you (Neeraj) in Turku," read the post on the games' official Instagram handle. The competition will also feature players like Anderson Peters and Jakub Vadlejch.

80.title: 2 Cong workers who protested against Kerala CM in flight arrested
80.article_body: Two Youth Congress workers, who had protested against Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on board a flight on Monday, have been arrested on the charges of attempted murder, police said. A third Youth Congress worker who was also booked in the matter has reportedly gone into hiding. This comes as CPI(M) MP V Sivadasan wrote to DGCA Director-General over the matter.

81.title: Men worship peepal tree to not get same wives in next birth in Maharashtra
81.article_body: Members of 'patni peedit' ashram in Aurangabad held an agitation demanding laws against injustice they face. The men took 108 rounds around a peepal tree, praying not to get the same wives again. Ashram founder said they worshipped the peepal as women will worship banyan trees and pray for the same husbands for seven lives on 'Vat Purnima' on Tuesday.

82.title: How's a banned game available?: NCPCR after UP boy shoots mother dead over PUBG
82.article_body: Child rights body NCPCR has written to the IT Ministry over reports that a 16-year-old boy in Uttar Pradesh shot his mother dead for stopping him from playing PUBG. "It's beyond understanding...how a banned game in India...is still available for use by minors," it said. The NCPCR has sought reasons from the government for availability of the blocked app.

83.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states over next few days, list released
83.article_body: IMD issued heavy rainfall warning for several states and UTs. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim, Nagaland, Meghalaya and Manipur during next five days. Heavy rainfall is likely over Jharkhand and Bihar from June 16 to 18. Isolated heavy rainfall is likely over Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh from June 15 to 17.

84.title: We have planned to continue attacking even if we lose wickets: Iyer
84.article_body: Indian batter Shreyas Iyer has said that the Indian team has planned to constantly go after the South African bowlers even if the former lose wickets. "Even if we keep losing wickets, it's our game plan and in the future too, we will go in with the same mindset. We will back ourselves and back our instincts," Iyer said.

85.title: New fake promise for polls?: Mayawati on PM's recruitment announcement
85.article_body: Reacting to PMO’s announcement that the Centre will recruit 10 lakh people in 1.5 years, BSP chief Mayawati asked, "Is this new fake promise for elections?" "Due to wrong policies and working style of the Centre, poverty...unemployment and devaluation of the rupee, each is at its peak," Mayawati tweeted. "Because of this, everyone is suffering and is restless," she added.

86.title: Climate crisis may lead to more violence towards women: Study
86.article_body: As per research published in the journal The Lancet Planetary Health, climate crisis has led to an increase in violence towards women, girls and sexual and gender minorities. Climate change-induced socioeconomic instability, structural power inequalities, breakdowns in safety and law enforcement etc could lead to an increase in gender-based violence across the world, scientists said.

87.title: Sri Lanka gives public workers extra day off to grow food
87.article_body: Sri Lanka's Cabinet has approved a four-day work week for public sector employees for the next three months to help them cope with a fuel shortage and encourage them to grow food in their backyards. Public servants will now have a holiday on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. The Friday leave won't apply to health, education, and other essential service sectors.

88.title: Air India's acquisition of AirAsia India approved by CCI
88.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Tuesday approved Tata Sons-owned Air India's proposal to acquire entire shareholding in AirAsia India. Prior to the acquisition, Tata Sons held a majority shareholding of 83.67% in AirAsia India, while the remaining stake was owned by AirAsia Investment Ltd (AAIL), part of Malaysia's AirAsia Group. Air India proposed to acquire AirAsia in April.

89.title: Karthik forced selectors to think 'Look, we can't ignore him': Kapil Dev
89.article_body: Former India captain Kapil Dev has praised wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik's recent performances, stating that the 37-year-old forced the selectors to not ignore him for selection in Team India. "Karthik has been playing cricket even before MS Dhoni. It's been 2 years since Dhoni retired but even now, Karthik has kept his motivation level high," Dev stated.

90.title: Water supply to be disrupted in some areas of Pune on June 16
90.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Tuesday said that the water supply in certain parts of the city will be disrupted on June 16 due to technical works. The affected areas include Anjali Nagar, Santosh Nagar, Sai Nagar, Datta Nagar, Telco Colony Campus, Sundhamata Nagar and Jambhulwadi Road Campus. Residents may receive low-pressure water supply the next day, PMC added.

91.title: UP man thrashes 3rd wife for objecting to his previous marriages
91.article_body: A man from UP married for the third time and allegedly beat his wife for objecting to his previous two marriages. The woman, in her complaint, said that the accused lied to her about being unmarried, adding that he started beating her when she objected to his previous marriages. The woman accused her in-laws of using casteist slurs.

92.title: Dangerous disconnect between science and govts over climate: UN
92.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday said there is a "historic and dangerous disconnect" between what science demands for climate action and what the governments are doing. "Many governments are dragging their feet. This inaction has grave consequences," he said at a climate conference in Austria. He added that the Russia-Ukraine conflict has worsened the crisis.

93.title: Sara shares pic on Sushant's death anniversary, says 'Many firsts happened because of you'
93.article_body: Sara Ali Khan shared an old picture with late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his second death anniversary. "From facing...camera for...first time to seeing Jupiter and...Moon through your telescope- so many firsts...happened because of you," she wrote. "Today on Full Moon night when I look up...I know you'll be up there amongst your favourite stars and constellations," Sara added.

94.title: Salman is 'unconditional' with everything except SKF: Kichcha Sudeepa
94.article_body: Talking about Salman Khan, Kannada actor Kichcha Sudeepa said Salman is "unconditional" with everything except his production house 'Salman Khan Films'. "He will only collaborate if he likes it. He has seen the clippings [of my upcoming film 'Vikrant Rona'] and he loved it," added Sudeepa. "I am still spellbound by the visuals," Salman had tweeted about the movie.

95.title: Chiranjeevi praises Adivi's 'Major', says 'It's not a film, it's an emotion'
95.article_body: Chiranjeevi took to Twitter to praise Adivi Sesh's latest film 'Major', writing, "[It's]...not a film, it's truly an emotion." He also shared some pictures from his meeting with Adivi and the team of 'Major'. Reacting to Chiranjeevi's tweet, Adivi wrote, "Today feels like my highest honour sir! You spoke to us for hours...Fed us...amazing lunch...and explained what you loved about...film."

96.title: Taking daily classes for 'Minimum', I hope they pay off: Saba Azad
96.article_body: Actress Saba Azad has stated in an interview that she has been taking daily classes for her upcoming film 'Minimum', adding that she hopes the classes pay off. "The biggest perk of cinema [is] the new skills you get to learn along the way," the actress added. She will be essaying the role of a French girl in the film.

97.title: US Health Secy tests +ve for COVID, 2nd time in less than a month
97.article_body: US Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Xavier Becerra has tested positive for coronavirus for the second time in less than a month. Becerra is "fully vaccinated and boosted against COVID-19, and is experiencing mild symptoms", HHS spokesperson Sarah Lovenheim said on Monday. The 64-year-old had previously tested positive for the virus in mid-May during a trip to Berlin.

98.title: Congress considers its leaders above law: BJP's Sambit Patra
98.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra on Tuesday said that the Congress considers its leaders above the law. His remarks came after Congress workers protested in support of Rahul Gandhi who was summoned by the ED in the National Herald money laundering case. Patra said, "When lawful action is taking place in...case of corruption, Congress is doing this drama and blocking roads."

99.title: Haryana man arrested for gold robbery on Jaipur Superfast Express train
99.article_body: Police arrested a man from Haryana in robbery case that took place in first-class compartment of Jaipur Superfast Express last month and seized gold worth ₹12.50 lakh from him. They are looking for three of his accomplices. The accused and his aides reportedly stole gold worth ₹24 lakh from a 62-year-old man while he was preparing to deboard the train.

100.title: Saying no to golgappa guy for Dangal scene was tough, gave 5-10 takes: Sanya
100.article_body: While recalling a scene from her first movie 'Dangal', actress Sanya Malhotra said that saying no to the golgappa guy for the scene was very tough for her. She added that she gave five to ten takes for that scene, some of which were because of technical reasons. "It felt very personal to me...I was really scared," she added.

101.title: Haven't slept for a week, I'm so nervous: Alia on Brahmastra trailer release
101.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt shared a video on Instagram, where she asked her fans to watch the trailer of Brahmastra, which is releasing on Wednesday. In the video, she's heard saying, "I haven't slept for a week now. I'm so nervous that I saw the trailer 25-30 times." "People have been asking me...many questions about Brahmastra all these years," she added.

102.title: Ukraine crisis can aggravate drug problem in Europe: EU body
102.article_body: The Ukraine crisis owing to the Russian invasion could potentially expose more people to narcotics, European Monitoring Centre for Drugs and Drug Addiction (EMCDDA) has warned. In its annual report, the EMCDDA said that people who have suffered "severe psychological stress" during the conflict may be more vulnerable to problems related to substance abuse in the future.

103.title: Musk-owned SpaceX raises $1.68 billion through equity financing
103.article_body: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX has raised $1.68 billion through equity financing, it said in a regulatory filing on Monday. SpaceX had aimed to raise $1.725 billion, media reports said citing filing. Earlier, SpaceX Starship spacecraft and Super Heavy rocket program in Texas cleared US FAA's environmental assessment. The FAA has imposed over 75 conditions on the company.

104.title: 4 caged mongooses rescued from businessman's home in Thane
104.article_body: The Maharashtra Forest Department officials from Thane's Kalyan have rescued four caged mongooses from the residence of a businessman, who believed that keeping mongooses at his home would bring him wealth and prosperity. "Keeping mongooses at home is a legal offence under the Wildlife (Protection) Act," a forest officer said. Officials said legal action has been taken against the businessman.

105.title: Man held for carrying katta at Delhi's Escorts Mujesar Metro Station
105.article_body: A man was held by the Central Industrial Security Force on Monday for carrying a katta (country-made pistol) at Delhi's Escorts Mujesar Metro Station. A constable detected an image of a weapon inside the accused's bag and alerted the CISF supervisor, following which a gun with a live round was discovered, reports said.

106.title: 7,440 bottles of foreign liquor worth over ₹25 lakh seized in Gurugram
106.article_body: Gurugram Police seized a truck loaded with 7,440 bottles of Indian-made foreign liquor worth more than ₹25 lakh. The truck was transporting the bottles from a liquor godown in Sector 46 to another one in Sector 47, police said. The vehicle was found parked near a school in Sector 47 by a crime branch team.

107.title: Congress's Srinivas BV forced into bus by police during protest in Delhi
107.article_body: Youth Congress President Srinivas BV was detained while he was protesting the Enforcement Directorate (ED) probe against party leader Rahul Gandhi in Delhi. In a video, police are seen forcefully pushing Srinivas in a bus full of detained Congress workers. Srinivas can be seen resisting attempts to push him onto the police bus.

108.title: Britney, Sam signed prenup 'in her favour' before wedding: Report
108.article_body: Singer Britney Spears and husband Sam Asghari signed a prenuptial agreement "in her favour" ensuring the money she made before their wedding is protected, reported Page Six. The 40-year-old singer got engaged to the 28-year-old personal trainer-turned-actor in September. Sam had earlier joked, "We're getting iron-clad prenup to protect my jeep and shoe collection incase she dumps me one day."

109.title: Baseless: Ali Abbas Zafar on rumours of 'Bade Miyan...' shelving
109.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar has refuted rumours of his film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' shelving. "This is absolutely baseless. We're...on track...there's no truth to the shelving rumours," he stated. "We'll go on floors by the end of this year or early next year and shoot in the UK," Ali added. Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff will feature in the film.

110.title: 32-yr-old civic volunteer found dead with multiple injuries in WB's Malda
110.article_body: A 32-year-old man, who worked as a civic volunteer, was found dead in West Bengal's Malda district on Monday. According to officials, Bachchan Mondal's body was found with multiple sharp cuts in a jute field behind the Bedrabad Rural Hospital. Mondal, who was posted at the Baishnabnagar police station, had left home on Sunday night without informing anyone, officials added.

111.title: Britney Spears' ex-husband charged with stalking after trying to gatecrash her wedding
111.article_body: A US court charged singer Britney Spears' ex-husband Jason Allen Alexander with a felony count of stalking on Monday after he attempted to gatecrash her wedding with Sam Asghari in southern California. The judge issued a restraining order requiring Alexander to stay 100 yards from Spears. He was also charged with misdemeanour counts of trespassing, vandalism and battery.

112.title: HC tells CBI to probe 'illegal' primary school teacher appointments in Bengal
112.article_body: The Calcutta High Court has directed the CBI to look into the appointments of 269 primary school teachers in West Bengal government schools over allegations that they did not pass the eligibility test. State Primary Education Board President Manik Bhattacharya and Secretary Ratna Chakraborty have been asked to appear before the CBI on Tuesday.

113.title: Maha ATS arrests UP youth in terror funding case, brings him to Pune
113.article_body: Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) arrested a 20-year-old youth from Uttar Pradesh's Deoband in connection with the terror funding and recruitment of operatives for Lashkar-e-Taiba. He was brought to Pune on transit remand from Saharanpur jail where he was lodged after his arrest for alleged terror activities, ACP of Pune ATS, said. UP Police had arrested him for previous terror offences.

114.title: Mahima thanks people involved in her Cancer treatment; Tina Ambani reacts
114.article_body: Actress Mahima Chaudhry took to Instagram to thank everyone who was a part of her Cancer treatment. She also mentioned Tina Ambani in her video along with other staff members at the Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital. Tina reshared Mahima's video and wrote, "Thank you...Mahima for your wonderful message. It's so gracious...of you to name everyone involved in your recovery."

115.title: Appointment of new Chief of Defence Staff soon: Rajnath Singh
115.article_body: Days after the government publicly revised the standards for the selection procedure of CDS, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has reportedly announced that the new Chief of Defence Staff will be appointed soon. According to an Economic Times report, the government is reviewing the records of around 30 active and retired officers for the CDS post.

116.title: Been answering if I regret quitting B'wood for 33 years: Bhagyashree
116.article_body: Bhagyashree, in an interview, said she has been answering if she regrets quitting Bollywood for the last 33 years. "My son, Abhimanyu...says everyone asks him the same question again," she stated. "No regrets because...I got the best of both worlds," she added. Bhagyashree quit Bollywood soon after making her debut with 'Maine Pyar Kiya' alongside actor Salman Khan.

117.title: Promise was to give 2 cr jobs a year: Surjewala on PM’s recruitment announcement
117.article_body: Soon after the PMO announced to recruit 10 lakh people in 1.5 years, Congress’ Randeep Singh Surjewala said the promise was to give two crore jobs every year. "Sixteen crore jobs were to be given in eight years. Now they're saying that by 2024, only 10 lakh jobs will be given," Surjewala tweeted. "Jumlebazi (mockery) for how long?" he added.

118.title: Man kills 6-month-old son after argument with wife in Punjab; held
118.article_body: A 29-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly killing his six-month-old son at his residence following an argument with his wife in Punjab's Zirakpur. The wife claimed that the accused had suffocated her son to death with his hands. A case has been filed against the accused under Section 302 (murder) of Indian Penal Code, a police officer said.

119.title: Hyd gang-rape accused were served biryani by police: BJP leader
119.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay has alleged that police offered biryani to all the men accused of raping a 17-year-old girl in the Jubilee Hills area of Hyderabad. He added that the gang-rape was pre-planned. "Telangana has become a hub of killings and rapes," Sanjay said at a public meeting in Jawaharnagar.

120.title: I'll not be Opposition candidate for President's post: Sharad Pawar
120.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar has said that he's not in the race for the Presidential election scheduled to be held on July 18, a report said. He said, "I'm not in the race...I'll not be an Opposition candidate for the President's post." Pawar's remark came after the Congress in Maharashtra said it'd support him for the President's post.

121.title: 'Agnipath' military recruitment model is visionary move: Indian Navy
121.article_body: Indian Navy on Tuesday praised the newly-unveiled armed forces' recruitment model 'Agnipath', calling it a "visionary move that will bring multi-dimensional transformations to the Navy". The model, which will employ aspirants (below officer rank) for four years, will have a "positive impact", Chief of Naval Staff R Hari Kumar said. The aspirants will undergo training for six months after joining.

122.title: We're disappointed: Adani as SL official says PM Modi 'pressured' to award project
122.article_body: Adani Group has responded after a top Sri Lankan official claimed that PM Narendra Modi "pressured" Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to award a power project to the company. "We are clearly disappointed by the detraction that seems to have come about," the Gautam Adani-led company said. It added that the issue has already been addressed by Sri Lankan government.

123.title: India may lose 8,000 individuals with over $1 million net worth in 2022: Report
123.article_body: India has ranked third on the list of top 10 countries that are expected to witness an outflow of high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs), with more than $1 million wealth, in 2022, as per a report by Henley and Partners. India may lose 8,000 HNWIs this year, the report said. The list includes Russia, China, Hong Kong, Ukraine, Brazil, UK and Mexico.

124.title: Agnipath scheme will make Army future-ready fighting force: Army Chief
124.article_body: Indian Army Chief General Manoj Pande said that Agnipath scheme will make Army future-ready fighting force capable of meeting multiple challenges across full spectrum of conflict. "It'll increase technical threshold of Army by recruiting 'Agniveers' through ITIs and other...institutes," he added. The government launched Agnipath scheme on Tuesday that aims to recruit youngsters in armed forces.

125.title: AQI likely to stay 'good' in Mumbai for next couple of days: SAFAR
125.article_body: Mumbai's Air Quality Index is likely to remain in the 'good' category for the next two days, the forecast from the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research read. It reported that Mumbai recorded an AQI of 28 on Monday, which was the best AQI of the year, while on Tuesday, the city's AQI was recorded at 37.

126.title: Fan shows his tribute tattoo to Federer at restaurant, Federer's reaction goes viral
126.article_body: A video of a fan showing his tribute tattoo to Roger Federer at a restaurant went viral. In the video, Federer can be seen rubbing the fan's arm to make sure the tattoo was real, before exclaiming, "Are you kidding me?" "There's no way around hard work. Embrace it. Federer, R," the tattoo read referring to a quote by Federer.

127.title: Umran is the second Indian player I’m excited to see after Sachin: Sunil Gavaskar
127.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that Umran Malik is the second Indian player he is excited to see after Sachin Tendulkar. "I do believe he should play, but again they might say that let us win the third T20I and get ourselves in a situation, and then maybe they can think about experimenting," he added.

128.title: Roger Federer now ranked 68th in the world, his worst ranking in 22 years
128.article_body: Ex-world number one Roger Federer is now ranked 68th in the world after having missed tournaments due to injury. It's the 20-time Grand Slam champion's worst ranking in over 22 years. Federer last featured in the Wimbledon in 2021. Meanwhile, Daniil Medvedev has reclaimed the number one spot. Alexander Zverev is world number two, while Djokovic is now ranked third.

129.title: World's 5 richest people including Musk collectively lost $345 bn in 2022
129.article_body: Among the world’s richest people, five billionaires collectively lost $345 billion this year, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. While Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao lost $85.6 billion in 2022 so far, he is followed by the world’s richest man Elon Musk, whose wealth declined by $73.2 billion. The world's 500 wealthiest people have collectively lost $1.4 trillion this year.

130.title: Amber Heard has a plan & strategy to make a comeback: Report
130.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has a "plan and strategy to make a comeback" after losing the defamation trial against Johnny Depp, reported ET. The report quoted a source saying Amber is planning to appeal the court's decision, adding that she feels very alone and like she lost a lot of friends. "She's confident...her side will come out eventually," the source added.

131.title: 'Vikram' director Lokesh gets mobbed by fans in Kerala, pics surface
131.article_body: 'Vikram' director Lokesh Kanagaraj and music composer Anirudh Ravichander were mobbed by fans at a theatre in Kerala's Thrissur. Vikram's Kerala distributor Shibu Thameens took to Twitter to share pictures from the theatre. The film, starring Kamal Haasan, Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Suriya, has earned more than ₹300 crore globally.

132.title: BJP is giving collective punishment to Indian Muslims: Owaisi
132.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said that BJP is giving collective punishment to Indian Muslims. "UP CM has become 'super Chief Justice'. He'll convict anybody in his own court," Owaisi added. "Afreen Fatima's house was in her mother's name...Why isn't BJP demolishing Teni's (son Ashish Mishra) home, accused of killing five people," he stated.

133.title: Cong to attend Opposition parties' meet called by Mamata Banerjee
133.article_body: Congress will take part in an Opposition leaders' meeting called by TMC chief and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on June 15 in Delhi, ANI reported quoting sources. Congress leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Jairam Ramesh and Randeep Singh Surjewala will reportedly take part in the meeting. The Opposition leaders' meeting has been scheduled ahead of the Presidential election on July 18.

134.title: Traffic curbs imposed in Mumbai ahead of PM Modi's visit
134.article_body: Traffic restrictions were imposed in Mumbai's Bandra (West) and Bandra Kurla Complex in Bandra (East) regions in view of PM Narendra Modi's visit to the city on Tuesday. The left turn taken from the Bandra-Worli sea link to go towards Lilavati hospital in Bandra (West) has been shut. PM Modi will attend Samachar Dwishatabdi programme at Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC).

135.title: 337 charged for violence in UP over Prophet remarks row, 13 cases filed
135.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has so far arrested 337 people from eight districts in connection with the violent protests over remarks against Prophet Muhammad. As many as 13 FIRs have been registered in nine districts, Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar said. Of the 337 people arrested, 92 are from Prayagraj and 83 from Saharanpur.

136.title: 4 women slap, beat Domino's female employee with stick for staring at them in MP
136.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a group of four women beating up a Domino's female employee for allegedly staring at them in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. The accused women could be seen slapping her and hitting her with a stick even as she cried in pain. A police case has reportedly been registered against the four women.

137.title: Disappointed Bob Saget left out of Tony’s Memorium segment: Stamos
137.article_body: Late actor Bob Saget was not included in the 'In Memoriam' segment of the Tony Awards. Ahead of the ceremony, actor John Stamos had tweeted, "Disappointed to hear that Bob will be LEFT OUT of the 'In Memoriam' segment tonight...Bob loved Broadway." The segment featured William Hurt, Sidney Poitier, Peter Scolari, Robert Morse, Joan Didion, Stephen Sondheim and more.

138.title: I don't deserve a place in Team India right now: Riyan Parag
138.article_body: RR batter Riyan Parag has said he "doesn't deserve" a place in Team India at the moment. "Right now, even I won't feel good if my name comes up in the probables' (list) for the Indian team," he stated. "If I can win six-seven matches for my team in a tournament, only then I'll be in the reckoning," Riyan added.

139.title: Cong doesn't understand speed with which economy is growing: Piyush
139.article_body: BJP leader and Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said that the Congress party doesn't understand the speed with which India's economy is growing. He further said that PM Narendra Modi's directive to provide recruitment to 10 lakh youth in different government departments and public sectors shows that youth will have a major contribution in developing modern India.

140.title: 2 Opposition MLAs, independent legislator join BJP in Madhya Pradesh
140.article_body: Two Opposition MLAs, including Sanjeev Singh Kushwaha from BSP, Rajesh Kumar Shukla from SP, and one independent legislator Vikram Singh Rana joined the BJP in Madhya Pradesh on Tuesday. With this, BJP's strength in the 230-member state Assembly rose to 130, with the Congress having 96 MLAs and BSP one. The development comes ahead of the Presidential election next month.

141.title: India is eternal because it is the land of saints: PM Modi in Pune
141.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who arrived in Pune on Tuesday, said that India is eternal because it's the land of saints. He said, "We're proud that we're one of the most ancient and living civilisations. Credit goes to the 'Sant parampara'...and the saints and sages of India." PM Modi inaugurated a Shila temple at the Sant Tukaram Maharaj Mandir in Pune.

142.title: What is Strawberry Moon that will rise in the skies tonight?
142.article_body: The June full moon, Strawberry Moon, will appear from around 5:22 pm in the skies above India on Tuesday. The name was given to the full Moon by the Algonquin Native American tribe in northeastern US and eastern Canada. It refers to the region's strawberry harvesting season. On Tuesday, it will come within 3,57,657 km of Earth.

143.title: Bajrang Dal to protest against violence over Prophet remarks: VHP
143.article_body: Bajrang Dal activists will stage a nationwide protest on Thursday against the incidents of violence over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Mohammad, said Vishva Hindu Parishad. "Bajrang Dal activists will hold a sit-in across all district headquarters on Thursday against continuous attack on Hindus by the jihadi fundamentalists," said VHP Secretary General Milind Parande.

144.title: Men aggrieved with their wives worship peepal tree in Maharashtra
144.article_body: A group of men, aggrieved with their wives, held an agitation in Maharashtra, demanding laws against "injustice" they face at home. The men also took 108 anti-clockwise rounds around a peepal tree, praying "not to get the same life partner again". "Many laws have been made to empower women, but they are also being misused," one of the men said.

145.title: 12-year-old girl killed by wild animal in J&K's Baramulla
145.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly killed by a wild animal in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla district on Tuesday. "The girl identified as Rutba Manzoor...was pounced upon by the wild animal and taken away to nearby forests," officials said. "Family and...locals tried to chase the animal, possibly a leopard...[It] however, disappeared in the dense forests with the child," they added.

146.title: Bihar MLA Anant Singh found guilty in 2019 arms recovery case
146.article_body: A special court in Bihar's Patna on Tuesday found RJD MLA Anant Singh guilty in a case regarding the recovery of an AK-47, ammunition and grenades from his ancestral house in 2019. The punishment will be pronounced on June 21. Singh's lawyer said, "[We'll] move the high court after...punishment is awarded." Singh is a four-time MLA from the Mokama constituency.

147.title: AIMIM directs leaders to not take part in any 'dharna' in UP
147.article_body: Following recent violence in UP, AIMIM directed its office bearers, leaders and workers in the state to not participate in any 'dharna' or demonstration organised in any district. "The party does not support any dharna or demonstration that are unconstitutional…Without any evidence or testimony of witness, the Prayagraj police blamed the AIMIM for the Friday violence," AIMIM’s Shaukat Ali said.

148.title: Yoga is a perfect blend of gyaan, karm and bhakti: PM Modi
148.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said that Yoga is a perfect blend of gyaan (knowledge), karm (action) and bhakti (devotion). PM Modi said, "In today's fast-paced world, peace of mind is very necessary, which we get from yoga." About 75 ministers from the Central government will reportedly perform yoga across 75 locations in India to mark International Yoga Day on June 21.

149.title: Which top 10 countries are expected to lose millionaires in 2022, as India ranks 3rd?
149.article_body: India has ranked third on the list of top 10 countries that are expected to witness an outflow of high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs), with more than $1 million wealth, in 2022, as per a report by Henley and Partners. The list of top 10 countries includes Russia, China, Hong Kong, Ukraine, Brazil, the UK, Mexico, Saudi Arabia, and Indonesia.

150.title: Federer is someone that is difficult to believe he's real: Tsitsipas
150.article_body: Praising Roger Federer, world number six Stefanos Tsitsipas said the 20-time Grand Slam champion is "someone that's difficult to believe he's real". He added, "When I first faced him, I was about to serve and...was thinking, 'Roger is on the other side of the net'. He's my childhood hero..it's incredible what he has done with all his records and...game style."

151.title: 2 drunk men try to enter Indore collectorate with swords
151.article_body: Two drunk men allegedly tried to enter the District Collector's office in Indore on Monday. "Both of them were allegedly drunk when they entered the office. We...will later hand them to the police for further action," Parasram Chauhan, a security jawan, said. One of them reportedly wanted to meet the collector with a complaint that his life was in danger.

152.title: Russia's actions are absolute evil: Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy
152.article_body: The actions of Russia in Ukraine are "absolute evil", Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. He added that Ukrainians have been paying a "very high" price in ongoing battles in the Donbas region, describing them as "one of the most brutal battles in Europe and for Europe". Zelenskyy also urged the West to send more weapons to Ukraine to defend itself.

153.title: EU to buy over 1 lakh monkeypox vaccine doses amid rising cases
153.article_body: The European Union (EU) will sign an agreement with an undisclosed vaccine maker on Tuesday to buy as many as 1,10,000 monkeypox vaccine doses, EU health commissioner Stella Kyriakides said. These doses will be delivered to EU states from the end of June onwards, she added. Over 1,200 monkeypox cases have been reported globally so far, according to WHO.

154.title: What are the pay & allowances under new Armed Forces recruitment model 'Agnipath'?
154.article_body: According to the Ministry of Defence, the yearly pay package for the candidates selected under the new four-year recruitment scheme in the Armed Forces will be about ₹4.76 lakh in the first year, which will increase to about ₹6.92 lakh in the fourth year. In addition, there are risk and hardship allowances and a tax-free ₹11.71 lakh payment on exit.

155.title: PM Modi greets devotees at Pune's Sant Tukaram Temple, video surfaces
155.article_body: PM Narendra Modi inaugurated Sant Tukaram Maharaj Temple in Pune district's Dehu on Tuesday. A video released by the Prime Minister's Office shows PM Modi greeting people on the temple premises. Later in the day, PM Modi will inaugurate the Jal Bhushan Building and Gallery of Revolutionaries at Raj Bhawan in Mumbai.

156.title: Aamir's always been perfectionist, regret not learning from him: Sonali
156.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre has said that her 'Sarfarosh' co-star Aamir Khan has always been a perfectionist. "When I did Sarfarosh with him, I enjoyed it so much and I could see what he was doing. But I didn't have the maturity to...learn from it," she added. Sonali further said that she regrets not being mature enough to grab the opportunity.

157.title: Leaves of police officials cancelled in Delhi over communal tension
157.article_body: The DCP of Delhi's northwest district has issued an order cancelling the leaves of all police personnel because of the current communal scenario and law and order situation in the national capital. "The officer/staff who are already running on leave shall join their place of duty at once, without fail," the order issued by DCP Usha Rangnani said.

158.title: Long queues seen at petrol pumps in some states after rumours of fuel shortage
158.article_body: Long queues of vehicles were seen at petrol pumps in some states, including Uttarakhand, Rajasthan and Gujarat, amid rumours of fuel shortage. Several pictures and videos showed cars, auto-rickshaws and two-wheelers waiting in queues of the petrol pumps in the different states. "Orders given to identify and take action against rumour-mongers," Dehradun DM R Rajesh Kumar said.

159.title: Baghel detained for protesting in Delhi, says 'Our protest will continue'
159.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister & Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel was detained by Delhi Police as he protested against the Enforcement Directorate's probe against party leader Rahul Gandhi. "Our protest will continue...what happened to ED cases against BJP leaders Himanta Biswa Sarma & Narayan Rane?...I've been detained," he added. Several other party leaders were also detained.

160.title: Akshay in talks with 'Stree' producer Dinesh Vijan for a film: Report
160.article_body: Akshay Kumar is reportedly in talks with producer Dinesh Vijan for a film. "It's a subject that Akshay and Dino (Dinesh) have been discussing for a while and have agreed to collaborate on the same," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. Dinesh has bankrolled films like 'Stree', 'Hindi Medium', 'Love Aaj Kal' and 'Mimi'.

161.title: Beijing launches probe into 24-hour bar blamed for COVID outbreak
161.article_body: Beijing's authorities have launched an investigation into a 24-hour bar that they believe to be at the centre of a cluster of over 250 COVID-19 cases in China's capital since last week. The investigation will be done "quickly" and "strictly",  the state-backed Beijing Daily said. All the city's bars, nightclubs, and other entertainment venues are also being inspected, it added.

162.title: PV Sindhu, Sai Praneeth knocked out of Indonesia Open after 1st round defeats
162.article_body: Indian shuttlers PV Sindhu and Sai Praneeth have been knocked out of the Indonesia Open 2022 after suffering defeats in their respective first-round games. Sindhu lost 14-21, 18-21 to China's He Bing Jiao, while Praneeth lost 16-21, 19-21 to Hans-Kristian Solberg Vittinghus of Denmark. Earlier in June, Sindhu had lost in Indonesia Masters' quarter-finals.

163.title: CBI court reserves order on Delhi minister Satyendar's bail plea till June 18
163.article_body: A CBI court on Tuesday reserved its order on the bail plea of Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain in an alleged money laundering case. The court will pronounce the order on June 18. The Enforcement Directorate had arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30. Jain is accused of having laundered money through at least four companies allegedly linked to him.

164.title: Centre will have to make efforts to fill over 1 cr vacant posts: Varun Gandhi
164.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Tuesday said Centre will have to make meaningful efforts to fill up over one crore "sanctioned but vacant posts." "To fulfil...promise of providing two crore jobs every year, steps will have to be taken at...faster pace," Varun tweeted. His reaction came after the central government announced to recruit 10 lakh people over next 1.5 years.

165.title: CBI court allows release of Lalu Yadav's passport for renewal
165.article_body: A CBI court in Patna has released RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's passport which was seized due to cases related to fodder scam. Yadav's lawyer Prabhat Kumar said, "[We'll] get...passport by tomorrow. [Yadav] will be able to travel to Singapore for kidney transplant." Yadav is currently on bail after completing over half of the jail term in a fodder scam.

166.title: Lake turns into desert amid record 13-year drought in Chile; pics surface
166.article_body: The Penuelas lake in central Chile, which was once the main source of water for the city of Valparaiso, has now turned into a desert amid record 13-year drought in the country. "We have to beg God to send us water. I've never seen it like this. There's been less water before, but not like now," said a 54-year-old.

167.title: This year we have to do it: Richa Chadha on wedding with Ali Fazal
167.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha stated that she will get married to boyfriend actor Ali Fazal this year and they are trying to fix the dates. She said, "Iss saal toh karni hi padegi (This year we have to do it only)." The couple was originally going to get married in 2020 but it had to be postponed due to the pandemic.

168.title: Pant hasn't cracked T20 code, dismissals make him look foolish: Jaffer
168.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer said Rishabh Pant hasn't cracked the T20 code, adding that Pant's dismissals can make him look "foolish" at times. Jaffer stated that Pant is not that good at rotating the strike and attempting to play according to the situation. Pant has scored 34 runs in the ongoing T20I series against South Africa.

169.title: Sharad Pawar not a contender for President post: NCP
169.article_body: A senior NCP leader reportedly claimed that the NCP chief Sharad Pawar is not keen on contesting the upcoming Presidential elections. "I don't think he (Pawar) is keen on it (contesting polls). Saheb (Pawar) is a people's man who loves meeting people. He will not restrict himself to the Rashtrapati Bhavan," the leader said.

170.title: Farmers protest outside Punjab MLA's house over moong procurement
170.article_body: Farmers staged a protest outside the residence of AAP MLA from Punjab's Sunam Aman Arora alleging that the government is not purchasing moong crop. However, Sangrur District Mandi Officer said that only bad quality moong wasn't being procured. "I've been trying to sell...crop for...15 days but no one is purchasing...not even at the price of ₹5,000/quintal," a protester said.

171.title: Farah recreates SRK's song 'Tumse Milke Dilka...' with Vicky, shares video
171.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan recreated Shah Rukh Khan's song 'Tumse Milke Dilka Jo Haal' with Vicky Kaushal and other members of their upcoming film 'Rola'. "When the whole crew dances you know it's been a great shoot...Vicky Kaushal you were lovely," Farah wrote while sharing the video on her Instagram handle. Karan Johar reacted to the video, writing, "This is epic."

172.title: Not impossible, but very difficult for Root to break Sachin's Test tally record: Gavaskar
172.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said it's "very difficult" for England's Joe Root to break Sachin Tendulkar's record of 15,921 Test runs. "[Sachin's record] is insurmountable...because we're talking about another almost 6000 runs, which means you would've to score about 1000 runs or 800 runs over the next eight years," explained Gavaskar. Currently, Root has scored 10,191 runs.

173.title: Google offers to let rivals place ads on YouTube in EU probe: Report
173.article_body: Google has offered to let rival ad intermediaries place ads on YouTube to address a crucial part of an EU probe, Reuters reported. The EU has been probing Alphabet to see if it gave itself an unfair advantage in digital advertising by restricting rivals' access to user data. Google has been discussing remedies with the EU since last year.

174.title: Maha Dy CM, Leader of Oppn receive PM Modi on his arrival in Pune
174.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today arrived in Maharashtra's Pune where he was received by state Deputy CM Ajit Pawar, Leader of Opposition Devendra Fadnavis and other dignitaries.
