The PM will inaugurate the Jagatguru Shrisant Tukaram Maharaj Temple in Dehu today afternoon. Earlier, the temple's trustees said that the entry of devotees will be barred on the inauguration day.

175.title: Air India fined ₹10 lakh for denying boarding to passengers with valid tickets
175.article_body: DGCA has imposed a fine of ₹10 lakh on Air India for denying boarding to passengers holding valid tickets. DGCA in its new guidelines stated that if a passenger holding a valid ticket is denied boarding, the airline will have to pay a compensation of up to ₹10,000 to the traveller if an alternate flight isn't arranged within an hour.

176.title: Leaders opposing free electricity can pay their full bills: Himachal CM
176.article_body: After facing opposition from Congress leaders over the decision to provide 125 units of electricity free of cost each month, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur invited the opposition to pay their bills in full. "It is surprising that these decisions have not gone down well...The leaders opposed to it should voluntarily give up the free power," CM Thakur said.

177.title: Cristiano doesn't get in my team: Gerrard on picking Messi over Ronaldo
177.article_body: Ex-Liverpool captain Steven Gerrard picked Lionel Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo, adding that Cristiano "doesn't get" in his team. "I am more about what you are going to do for the team...So I will always go down that road," stated Gerrard. "Messi...is more of a team player," he had earlier said. Dinesh Karthik had also picked Messi over Cristiano.

178.title: Have been dealing with back & knee pain: Kylie Jenner on postpartum
178.article_body: Kylie Jenner opened up about her four-month postpartum while sharing a video of herself in the gym on Instagram Stories. Kylie wrote, "I have been dealing with tons of back and knee pain this time so it slows down my workouts but I'm on a mission to get strong again." Kylie gave birth to her second child earlier this year.

179.title: Have lifetime of entertaining left: Kiara Advani on 8 yrs in B'wood
179.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani completed eight years in Bollywood on Monday. "June 13th! the day I stepped into this magical world of filmmaking...My heart is filled with gratitude," Kiara wrote on Instagram. "I maybe 8 years old today but I have a lifetime of entertaining left to do," she further added. Kiara made her debut with the 2014 film 'Fugly'.

180.title: 55 people killed in suspected militant attack in Burkina Faso
180.article_body: At least 55 people were killed in a suspected militant attack in northern Burkina Faso over the weekend, said the authorities on Monday. According to the government, the civilians were targeted in Seytenga in the Seno province. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack so far, however, some experts say that the Islamic State group was likely behind it.

181.title: I would not have Dinesh Karthik in India's T20 WC 2022 squad: Gambhir
181.article_body: Talking about the T20 World Cup 2022, Gautam Gambhir said, "Once KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma, Suryakumar Yadav and Virat Kohli are back, I don't see [Dinesh Karthik] in the playing XI." "If Karthik doesn't have a place in the playing XI, there's no point...[including] him...in the squad," added Gambhir. Gambhir stated he would "definitely" include Deepak Hooda in the squad.

182.title: Scientists develop screening process to predict heart attack risk from eye test
182.article_body: Scientists have developed a screening process that combines information about pattern of retina's blood vessels with genetic data to predict the risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) and its potentially fatal outcome, myocardial infarction, commonly known as a heart attack in an individual. Scientists say processes could also be developed to predict diseases like diabetic retinopathy and stroke.

183.title: Gambhir literally made me who I'm today: Sheldon Jackson
183.article_body: KKR wicketkeeper-batter Sheldon Jackson has credited Gautam Gambhir for his cricketing career, stating that the ex-India opener backed him when no one knew him. "Gambhir literally made me who I'm today...He got me into KKR and groomed [me]. He's my idol...he is the one man I always look up to," he stated. Sheldon played five games in IPL 2022.

184.title: I got a lot of motivation after Babar Azam called me a 'buddha': Shadab Khan
184.article_body: After scoring 86 and taking four wickets against West Indies in third ODI, Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan said, "I got a lot of motivation after Babar Azam called me...‘buddha’ (old man)." Shadab added he has been working hard on his fitness. Babar had called Shadab "buddha" after he missed a run-out chance during a T20 World Cup 2021 warm-up match.

185.title: Hundreds of penguins washing up dead on NZ beaches due to rising ocean temperatures
185.article_body: Hundreds of world's smallest penguins are washing up dead on New Zealand beaches. The kororā, also known as little blue penguins, are being found in the northern-most region of the North Island. The NZ Department of Conservation said that an estimated 200 tiny birds were washing up daily and that the mass die-offs were being caused by rising ocean temperatures.

186.title: DR Congo accuses Rwanda of 'invasion' as rebels seize town
186.article_body: The Democratic Republic of the Congo has accused Rwanda of "invasion" after M23 rebels captured a key border town. DR Congo's military vowed that its forces would defend their homeland, marking an escalation in tensions between the two Central African neighbours. Rwanda hasn't commented on the allegations but in the past has denied accusations that it supports the M23 rebels.

187.title: New Armed Forces recruitment model 'Agnipath' unveiled, youth to serve for 4 years
187.article_body: The three service chiefs on Tuesday revealed the details of new recruitment model for the Armed Forces called 'Agnipath' with Defence Minster Rajnath Singh. Lieutenant General Anil Puri said, "We are looking at the best to serve the Armed Forces between the ages of 17.5 to 21 years." He added, "Once selected, Agniveers will serve for four years with us."

188.title: Thane Police website hacked, hackers demand apology to 'Muslims all over world'
188.article_body: The website of Thane City Police Commissionerate was hacked on Tuesday, reports said. Reports added that a message was allegedly displayed on the website, demanding an apology to 'Muslims all over the world'. It further said, "Hello Indian government, Hello everyone. Again and again you make trouble with the problem of the Islamic religion."

189.title: 5 arrested over Ranchi violence; Governor summons DGP, top officials
189.article_body: As many as five persons have been arrested in connection with the Friday violence that broke out in Jharkhand's Ranchi over remarks on Prophet Muhammad, police said. At least six named accused are also under medical treatment, as per the police. Notably, Jharkhand Governor Ramesh Bais on Monday also summoned DGP Neeraj Sinha and other senior officials.

190.title: Recruitment of 10 lakh people will give new confidence to youths: Amit Shah
190.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said that PM Narendra Modi's directive to recruit 10 lakh people in all government departments "in 1.5 years will bring new hope...confidence among the youth". "The basis of new India is its youth power," Shah said. Notably, the Centre has set a deadline for filling up 10 lakh government vacancies by December 2023.

191.title: When Bollywood needs me, they know my contact number: Rapper Raja Kumari
191.article_body: Indian-American rapper Raja Kumari said that she does not go after singing in Hindi even though Bollywood stories are appealing. "I did Husn Parcham for Shah Rukh Khan in 'Zero'...then Wakhra Swag in 'Judgementall Hai Kya'...It was released within days of it being recorded. I know that when Bollywood needs me, they know my contact number," she added.

192.title: Air pollution reducing life expectancy in India by 5 years: Study
192.article_body: Air pollution is reducing the life expectancy of Indians by five years, stated Chicago University's Air Quality Life Index. The entire Indian population of 1.3 billion people live in areas that exceed the WHO limit of annual average particulate pollution. As per analysis, over 63% people live in areas that exceed India's own annual air quality standard of 40 µg/m3.

193.title: She loves pulling pranks on people: Vikrant on working with Radhika Apte
193.article_body: Vikrant Massey, speaking about working with Radhika Apte in the upcoming film 'Forensic', said, "She's such a riot off-screen...She loves pulling pranks on people." "I'm really glad...I did this film with her," he added. "We both have been wanting to work with each other for quite some time and here we're for...first time collaborating on an incredible movie," said Vikrant.

194.title: India have been unfortunate, they have batted first vs SA so far: Manjrekar
194.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said India have been unfortunate that they have lost the toss in the first two matches in the ongoing T20I series against South Africa. "India have batted first [so far] and batting second is always an advantage, no matter what people say," Manjrekar stated, adding that management should play Umran Malik in the third T20I.

195.title: Govt officer gets 5-yr imprisonment for taking ₹7,500 bribe in B'luru
195.article_body: A special court in Bengaluru sentenced a Co-operative Development officer to five years of rigorous imprisonment for accepting a bribe of ₹7,500. The court also ordered the convict, identified as HP Sadashiva, to pay a fine of ₹10,000. According to the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), Sadashiva demanded bribes from a person who had approached him to register Dhanushree Apartment Owners' Association.

196.title: Canadian who rammed van into crowd killing 11 jailed for life
196.article_body: A Canadian man who rammed his rental van into dozens of pedestrians in Toronto in 2018, killing 11 people, has been sentenced to life imprisonment. Alek Minassian was found guilty last year of murdering 10 people and attempting to murder. The death toll rose to 11 after a woman died in October 2021 from injuries she suffered in 2018 attack.

197.title: China needs to lift sanctions to improve relations: Australian PM
197.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese has called for removal of trade sanctions imposed by China to improve relations between the two countries. "It is China that has imposed sanctions on Australia. They need to remove those sanctions in order to improve relations," he said. This comes after the Australian Defence Minister met his Chinese counterpart at a conference in Singapore.

198.title: Indian adaptation of 'Fauda' titled 'Tanaav'; to feature Arbaaz, Rajat Kapoor
198.article_body: The Indian adaptation of the Israeli spy series 'Fauda' has been titled 'Tanaav'. Set in Kashmir in 2017, the 12-episode show will feature Rajat Kapoor, Arbaaz Khan, Zarina Wahab and Arslan Goni among others. Avi Issacharoff, co-creator of 'Fauda', said, "It's a true honour...to learn how Fauda succeeded to touch...hearts of so many people from all over the world."

199.title: Was being torn apart, legs broke with so much dance: Deepak on Khiladi
199.article_body: Talking about Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Khiladi', actor Deepak Tijori said, "There was so much dance that our legs and hamstrings were breaking...I was literally being torn apart." "Akshay was into physical fitness while I was a little easy with my life! Hence, it was worse for me," added Deepak. "It was a crazy ride...The movie...was truly something else!" stated Deepak.

200.title: India's wholesale inflation rises to record 15.88% in May as against 15.08% in Apr
200.article_body: India’s Wholesale Price Index (WPI) surged to a record high of 15.88% in May, up from 15.08% in April, data released by the government showed. The WPI inflation was 13.11% in May 2021. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry attributed the high inflation in May to a rise in "prices of mineral oils, crude petroleum and food articles", among others.

201.title: Cong leaders Surjewala, Venugopal & others detained amid protest in Delhi
201.article_body: Congress workers and leaders were detained on Tuesday as they held a protest for the second consecutive day in Delhi over Enforcement Directorate questioning party leader Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald money laundering case. Congress leaders like Randeep Surjewala, KC Venugopal, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, Gaurav Gogoi, Deepender Hooda, Ranjeet Ranjan, Imran Pratapgarhi and others were detained.

202.title: I don't think Brendon McCullum will be shutting up shop on Day 5: Boult
202.article_body: After New Zealand finished Day 4 at 224/7, leading with 238 runs in the second Test, pacer Trent Boult said he expects England coach Brendon McCullum to instruct England to go for the win on Day 5. "I don't think McCullum will be shutting up shop," stated Boult. "We'll focus on extending lead...[then] hopefully bowl for win," he added.

203.title: Treating accused as convicts unlawful, creates terror: AIMPLB
203.article_body: After houses of violence-accused were demolished in UP, the All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) said that treating accused as convicts was unlawful and a way of creating terror and panic. An official said that instead of acting against the individual who insulted Prophet Muhammad, the government is lodging FIRs and demolishing houses of those who protested against it.

204.title: Rhea shares old pics with Sushant on his death anniversary, says 'Miss you every day'
204.article_body: Actress Rhea Chakraborty took to Instagram to share old pictures with late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his second death anniversary. "Miss you every day," she wrote. Sushant's sister Shweta Singh Kirti also shared a picture, writing, "It has been two years since you left your mortal abode, Bhai, but you've become immortal because of the values you stood for."

205.title: Wife of violence accused UP activist is the owner of demolished house, records show
205.article_body: According to records, the house of Prayagraj violence accused activist Javed Mohammad which was demolished on Sunday is in his wife Parveen Fatima's name. The house tax for financial year 2020-2021 and a water bill dated February 8 are paid, records showed. However, authorities said that construction was done in violation of Uttar Pradesh Urban Planning and Development Act, 1973.

206.title: Cong protesting against misuse of law, ED not following it: P Chidambaram
206.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said Congress is protesting against the misuse of law as the ED is not following it. "If ED follows the law, we have no problem," Chidambaram added. "We are asking what's the scheduled offence? There's no answer. Which police agency has registered an FIR? No answer, no copy of FIR," he stated.

207.title: Indian street food restaurant Chai Pani named best in US
207.article_body: Chai Pani, which serves Indian street food in North Carolina, was named US' Outstanding Restaurant at the James Beard Foundation Awards in Chicago on Monday. The menu at Chai Pani features 'Bhel Puri', 'Sweet Potato Chaat' and 'Green Mango Chaat'. It was the first time the honours were awarded in two years, after being cancelled in 2020 and 2021.

208.title: It's completely Made in India: Preity amid reports of IPL media rights fetching ₹44,000 cr
208.article_body: Amid reports of IPL TV and digital rights fetching more than ₹44,000 crore, PBKS co-owner Preity Zinta tweeted, "Waiting to hear...BCCI announce the new IPL media rights." She added, "What an incredible sports property IPL has become! Employing thousands & entertaining billions across the globe...it's dwarfing all other sports leagues by its incredible growth and it’s completely Made In India."

209.title: Delhi Police detained 459 Congress workers, leaders in Day 1 protest
209.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday detained 459 Congress workers and leaders for not following police directions amid the first day of protest, officials said. The party workers were protesting in support of party leader Rahul Gandhi, who appeared before Enforcement Directorate in the National Herald money laundering case. Earlier, the Delhi Police had denied permission to Congress to hold the protest.

210.title: This storm will pass: Justin Bieber on Ramsay Hunt syndrome recovery
210.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber, taking to Instagram Stories, wrote, "Each day has gotten better...through all of the discomfort, I've found comfort in the one who designed me and knows me." "I know this storm will pass but in the meantime, Jesus is with me," he added. This comes after Justin had revealed that Ramsay Hunt syndrome had caused partial facial paralysis.

211.title: 2 killed, 4 injured as temple chariot overturns in Tamil Nadu's Dharmapuri
211.article_body: At least two persons died and four were injured after a temple chariot overturned in Papparapatti in Tamil Nadu's Dharmapuri, police said. "The chariot overturned all of a sudden...two men who got caught under the chariot's wooden wheel died," police added. CM MK Stalin has announced cash assistance of ₹5 lakh each to the families of the deceased.

212.title: Goa govt to seek fitness certificates from coaches every 2 yrs
212.article_body: The Goa Sports Minister Govind Gaude has announced that the sports coaches employed with the state sports department will have to submit their fitness certificates every two years. "Once coaches are employed, the sports department never checks their fitness...Can an unfit coach produce a fit player?" Gaude asked. He added that only 35-40 out of 130 departmental coaches are professional.

213.title: Maradona always had more personality on a team than Messi: Van Basten
213.article_body: Former AC Milan striker Marco van Basten said Diego Maradona "always" had "more personality" on a team than Lionel Messi, adding Messi is "not" the one who "puts himself in front to go to war". "Pelé, Maradona and Johan Cruyff...are the three greatest players in history. As a kid I wanted to be like Cruyff," stated Van Basten.

214.title: 3 members of a family drown while bathing in Ganga in UP's Mirzapur
214.article_body: Three members of a family drowned while bathing in Ganga river in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district on Monday. According to Additional Superintendent of Police, Sanjay Kumar Verma, a family of 11 people from Ambedkarnagar was visiting the Vindhyachal temple when three members got into the river and drowned. Two of the deceased were 16-year-old while another was 17-year-old, Verma added.

215.title: 4 killed in massive landslide after heavy rains lash Assam's Guwahati
215.article_body: Four people died in a landslide in Assam's Guwahati on Tuesday. The victims, who worked as construction labourers, were living in a rented house. "The wall of the house had broken down and the soil of hills entered the house and the labourers were trapped in the debris," police said. Heavy rainfall has been lashing Assam since Monday night.

216.title: Manila church to open exorcism centre amid 'storm of possessions'
216.article_body: A Catholic church in Manila is set to open an exorcism centre, which it said would be the first of its kind in Asia, amid a surge in possessions since the COVID-19 pandemic struck. The pandemic caused mental, spiritual and physical stress that made for a "perfect storm for possessions and demonic intervention", the church said, according to a report.

217.title: It's time for 3rd unicorn: Ashneer as he shares his 40th birthday post
217.article_body: BharatPe's former MD Ashneer Grover took to Twitter to share a post on his 40th birthday. He wrote, "Today I turn 40. Some will say I have lived a full life and experienced more things than most. Created value for generations. For me, it's still unfinished business. Time to disrupt another sector. It's time for the third unicorn."

218.title: He can’t decide what UP govt will do: Ajay Mishra on Owaisi’s remark on CM
218.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni said that AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has no right to decide what the UP government and the court will do. His statement came in reaction to Owaisi’s remark saying that UP CM Yogi Adityanath has become the "Chief Justice" of Allahabad HC, after Prayagraj violence accused Javed Ahmed’s property was demolished.

219.title: Civic body to begin work on Gurugram's sports, cultural complex from Aug
219.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Gurugram is all set to begin the construction work of the city's sports stadium and a cultural complex from August this year. The sports stadium, which will come up at Wazirabad, will be Gurugram's second sports stadium after the Tau Devi Lal Sports Complex near Rajiv Chowk. Notably, the cultural complex will be a first for Gurugram.

220.title: Drunk Hyderabad man reaches mom's house, smashes door with hammer
220.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Tuppati Sai Baba, was sent to jail after he reached his mother's house while being drunk in Hyderabad. He reportedly created a ruckus in front of the house and smashed the door with a hammer. Reports said that his mother told the police that he would often torment his wife and children.

221.title: Southwest monsoon arrives in Hyderabad after a delay of 5 days
221.article_body: The Southwest Monsoon arrived in Hyderabad on Monday after a delay of five days. According to the India Meteorological Department's (IMD) Hyderabad office, the monsoon has extended to Mahabubnagar district and is further likely to advance in the next 48 hours. A 'Yellow Alert' warning has been issued for several districts in Telangana including Adilabad, Narayanpet, Mancherial and Nirmal.

222.title: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra's mother passes away, he says 'I am now officially an orphan'
222.article_body: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra took to Twitter to share that his mother has passed away. "My mother passed away into the great beyond an hour ago. My sister and I both held her hand as she went. I am now officially an orphan," he wrote. Mishra's mother had been hospitalised and was critical for the last few days.

223.title: Which states/UTs have the cleanest air in India?
223.article_body: Ladakh has the cleanest air in India, followed by Arunachal Pradesh, Kerala, Andaman and Nicobar, and Puducherry, according to Energy Policy Institute at the University of Chicago's Air Quality Life Index. Tamil Nadu has been ranked 6th, followed by Goa, Nagaland, Karnataka and Dadra and Nagar Haveli. Delhi is most polluted in India, followed by UP, Bihar and Haryana.

224.title: Journalist Navika Kumar booked over Prophet remarks in Maharashtra: Report
224.article_body: Times Now news anchor Navika Kumar has been named in an FIR filed at Nanalpet police station in Maharashtra's Parbhani on the complaint of a Muslim cleric for allegedly intending to outrage religious sentiments, Newslaundry reported. This comes after former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma made remarks against Prophet Muhammad on her show. Times Now had distanced itself from Sharma's remarks.

225.title: Indigenous groups in Ecuador burn tyres, block roads over fuel prices
225.article_body: Indigenous groups across Ecuador on Monday blocked key roads and burned tyres in protest against rising gasoline prices and the economic policies of President Guillermo Lasso. Protestors are calling on Lasso's government to freeze gasoline costs at a lower price, stop plans to expand oil and mining development, and extend deadlines for small farmers to pay off debts with banks.

226.title: She's a surprise package in Brahmāstra: Ayan after sharing Mouni's look
226.article_body: 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji shared Mouni Roy's first look from the film on Instagram. Along with the look, he wrote, "A lot of people...are going to walk out of 'Brahmāstra', talking about Mouni's performance as Junoon." "I offered her a 'special appearance'...Eventually, she shot with us from our first day to...last schedule, and...the surprise package in the film," he added.

227.title: Our 'Satyagrah' won’t stop: Surjewala on Rahul's ED questioning
227.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala on Tuesday said that probe by the ED against party leader Rahul Gandhi is an attempt to muzzle his voice. "We are Gandhi's heirs, we will once again walk, our 'Satyagrah' won't stop," Surjewala added. Furthermore, he said that Rahul has always questioned PM Narendra Modi-led government on unemployment, price hike and religious vendetta.

228.title: VHP calls for Hanuman Chalisa mass recitation in Delhi at 8 pm today
228.article_body: Delhi VHP chief Kapil Khanna has called for mass recitation of Hanuman Chalisa in Delhi temples at 8 pm today to protest against June 10 violence in several parts of the country. "Illegal fatwas were issued for the killing of Nupur Sharma...Hindu society rejects and strongly condemns...pressure that was built on...Hindu society due to such illegal demonstrations," Khanna said.

229.title: TotalEnergies to buy 25% stake in Adani New Industries for green hydrogen project
229.article_body: French energy company TotalEnergies on Tuesday said it will acquire a 25% stake in Adani New Industries Limited (ANIL) to jointly develop a green hydrogen ecosystem. ANIL plans to invest over $50 billion over the next 10 years in green hydrogen. In the initial phase, ANIL will develop a green hydrogen production capacity of 1 million tonnes/annum before 2030.

230.title: May Sikandar Kher get married soon: Anupam wishes Kirron on b'day
230.article_body: Anupam Kher, taking to Instagram on Tuesday, shared a post wishing his wife, actress and politician Kirron Kher, on her 70th birthday. Sharing some pictures of Kirron, he wrote, "Happy Birthday dearest #Kirron! May you have a long, healthy and peaceful life...May you continue to serve the people of #Chandigarh for many years. May Sikandar Kher get married soon."

231.title: Low-hanging fruit is targeted: Parthiv on possible changes in India's XI vs SA
231.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said pacer Avesh Khan might be dropped from India's XI for the third T20I against South Africa for the possible inclusion of Arshdeep Singh in the team. "Avesh hasn't done anything that should get him dropped. Sometimes, the low-hanging fruit is targeted," stated Parthiv. Avesh went wicketless in the first two T20Is against South Africa.

232.title: Mistakes often happen in rage: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Ranchi violence
232.article_body: Commenting on the Friday violence that broke out in Jharkhand's Ranchi over remarks on Prophet Muhammad, CM Hemant Soren said that mistakes often happen in rage. "Today, behind every news item, every video, there is a hidden agenda," he added. "Is this a small mistake? This statement does not have any standing in democracy," BJP MP Sanjay Seth said.

233.title: Cyberabad police shares video, says, 'Jumping red light dangerous'
233.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Tuesday shared an old video of a hit and run accident at a road crossing, saying, "Stopping at red light is a basic traffic rule. Jumping red light is always dangerous." The video shows a car hitting a bike after purportedly jumping a red light. The car driver was traced, the traffic police added.

234.title: Lady Gaga in talks to play Harley Quinn in 'Joker 2': Report
234.article_body: Singer-actress Lady Gaga is in talks to play the role of Harley Quinn in the 'Joker: Folie à Deux', a report by Hollywood Reporter stated. Earlier, director Todd Phillips announced the sequel to the 2019 film on Instagram. The report added the sequel may be a musical. Margot Robbie played the role of Harley Quinn in the 'Suicide Squad' franchise.

235.title: Tesla fires its top Singapore executive after Musk warned of 10% job cuts
235.article_body: Tesla has fired its Singapore country manager, who had joined the company a year ago. Christopher Bousigues shared a LinkedIn post and wrote, "Proud to have been Tesla's first country manager in South East Asia". Earlier, Elon Musk in a leaked email said he would cut 10% of Tesla's workforce as he had a "super bad feeling" about the economy.

236.title: 19-yr-old girl dies after assault by live-in partner in Mumbai
236.article_body: A 19-year-old girl died after being allegedly beaten by her 22-year-old live-in partner in Andheri (East) in Mumbai. The accused, Stephen Morris, was in a relationship with the deceased, Rihana Shaikh, since last year despite the disapproval from the latter's family. Morris tried to blame Shaikh's ex-boyfriend for the assault but was arrested based on the eyewitness accounts, police said.

237.title: 3 terrorists sent by Pakistani handlers to target Amarnath Yatra killed in Srinagar
237.article_body: Three terrorists were neutralised by police in an encounter in Srinagar on Monday night. The IGP Kashmir said that Pakistan-based handlers had sent two Pakistani terrorists of LeT terror outfit along with one local terrorist Adil Hussain Mir of Pahalgam, who had been in Pakistan since 2018 (now all three killed), with the intention to attack Amarnath Yatra.

238.title: Mockery of justice: Trump on US Congress probe into Capitol riots
238.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump criticised the congressional inquiry into the riot by his supporters at the US Capitol last year as a "mockery of justice". Trump said the Democratic-led panel was "a Kangaroo Court, hoping to distract...Americans...from the great pain they're experiencing". This comes after the committee held two public hearings accusing Trump of an attempted coup.

239.title: 2 yrs since you left, you changed world: Sushant's sister on death anniversary
239.article_body: Late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's sister Shweta Singh Kirti took to Instagram to share picture of her late brother on his second death anniversary. "It has been 2 years since you left...you have become immortal because of...the values you stood for...you have changed the world for the better and will continue to do so even in your absence," she wrote.

240.title: Kerala CPI(M) MP writes to DGCA alleging assault on CM on a flight
240.article_body: CPI(M) Rajya Sabha MP from Kerala Dr V Sivadasan wrote to DGCA Director-General alleging an assault on Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on a flight from Kannur to Thiruvananthapuram. "I would like to invite your attention to the heinous attempt to physically attack the CM...posing a grave threat to his life," he added. Sivadasan demanded an investigation on the matter.

241.title: Karnataka logs 415 new COVID-19 cases, 400 in Bengaluru alone
241.article_body: Karnataka on Monday reported 415 new cases of COVID-19, out of which 400 cases were reported from Bengaluru alone. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), zero deaths were reported in the last 24 hours while 354 people recovered from the virus. With 3,542 active cases, the positivity rate in Bengaluru now stands at 2.69%, data showed.

242.title: 3 killed, 4 injured in shooting at warehouse party in US
242.article_body: Three people were killed and four injured after a shooting took place at a warehouse party in the US' Los Angeles, said authorities. The motive behind the shooting has not been found and no information on any suspect has been released so far, as per reports. A local rapper, who had performed at the party, expressed his condolences.

243.title: He's different: Dinesh Karthik on picking Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo
243.article_body: Having picked Lionel Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo, Dinesh Karthik said Messi is "different", adding he has enjoyed watching the PSG forward so far. Former Real Madrid defender Roberto Carlos had selected Cristiano over Messi in his ultimate Champions League XI. "Cristiano represents exactly what the Champions League is and modern football. We will only have one Cristiano," Carlos had stated.

244.title: ED's questioning of Rahul Gandhi is political vendetta: Deepender Hooda
244.article_body: Congress leader Deepender Hooda condemned the questioning of Rahul Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and called it a "political vendetta". "The voice of Rahul Gandhi and Congress will not be silenced by these actions," Hooda added. Notably, Rahul Gandhi on Monday left the ED office in Delhi after about 10 hours of questioning in the National Herald case.

245.title: Huge joy: Shanaka on SL's record chase in final 3 overs vs Australia
245.article_body: Talking about chasing down 59 runs in the final three overs of the third T20I against Australia, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said, "It was a huge joy...to be able to play an innings like that." He added, "Plan was to hit three [sixes] an over in the last three overs...[but] There was a chance it would all go wrong."

246.title: Congress govt in Rajasthan cheating and betraying farmers: BJP
246.article_body: Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia on Monday accused Congress of cheating the farmers. "The Congress government in the state is cheating and betraying the farmers in the name of farm loan waiver and auction of lands," he alleged. "On the other hand, the BJP-led Central government will give PM-Kisan Samman Nidhi to the farmers of the country," he added.

247.title: Girl falls off mom's lap in front of bus in U'Khand, CPU official saves her
247.article_body: A City Patrol Unit personnel saved the life of a child who reportedly fell in front of a bus on the road in Uttarakhand. The child fell off her mother's lap from an e-rickshaw, reports said. An official said that the CPU personnel signalled the bus to stop and saved the child's life without caring for his own.

248.title: My father's generation helped cricket grow when there was no money: Kaif on pension hike
248.article_body: Former India batter Mohammad Kaif took to Twitter to thank BCCI for hiking monthly pension for former cricketers and umpires. "My father, Mohammad Tarif, is always very happy when he gets his pension," he wrote. He added, "His generation helped the game grow when there was no money. By remembering their contribution, BCCI has shown a big heart."

249.title: Rakhi's ex-husband denies hacking her accounts, says 'Will file defamation case'
249.article_body: Rakhi Sawant's ex-husband Ritesh has denied her claims that he hacked her social media accounts. "She has given her passwords to a few...people and earlier too...her social media account was hacked. I was the one who helped her recover her account," Ritesh said, adding he'll file a defamation case against her as he has suffered business losses because of her.

250.title: Sonia, Rahul called to ED office to harass them: Mallikarjun Kharge
250.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday accused the BJP-led government of harassing Sonia and Rahul Gandhi over the National Herald case. "This is nothing but politics...Had there been a legal point in this case, it wouldn't have taken eight years (for action)," Kharge said. "Making them sit for hours (at ED office) and harass them is political vendetta," he alleged.

251.title: Guj villagers lock school over alleged misuse of funds; probe on
251.article_body: Residents from the Sundhiya village in Gujarat's Mahesana locked a government primary school on Monday alleging that the principal was misusing government grants using fake bills. However, officials claimed that government grants can only be used following permission from school management committees, which include parents. District Education Officer has ordered an investigation into the matter.

252.title: 'How to Murder Your Husband' writer jailed for life for murdering husband for money
252.article_body: US-based romance novelist Nancy Crampton-Brophy, who published an essay called 'How to Murder Your Husband' in 2011, has been sentenced to life in prison for murdering her husband. A jury found that she shot her husband of 26 years in 2018 for a $1.5-million life insurance pay-out. Nancy was convicted of the murder last month.

253.title: Siddhanth Kapoor refused to show rock star doing drugs in film: Director
253.article_body: Writer-director Sarim Momin recalled working with actor Siddhanth Kapoor, who was recently detained in Bengaluru after he allegedly tested positive for drug consumption at a rave party. Momin said he wanted Siddhanth to play a rock star who does drugs. "It was Siddhant who...said 'Let's not...show my character as someone who does drugs...doesn't send out a good message'," he added.

254.title: Hate speeches are starting point of targeted attacks: Delhi HC
254.article_body: Hate speeches by politicians and religious leaders warrant stringent action, said the Delhi High Court. "Hate speeches are the beginning point of attacks against the targeted community that can range from discrimination to ostracism, ghettoisation, deportation and even to genocide," it added. It rejected a plea against Union Minister Anurag Thakur and MP Parvesh Verma over alleged hate speeches.

255.title: SpaceX project clears US FAA review, 75 conditions placed
255.article_body: SpaceX Starship spacecraft and Super Heavy rocket program in Texas cleared US FAA's environmental assessment with more than 75 conditions to mitigate environmental impacts. The mitigations include protections for water resources, limits on noise levels, and biohazard materials control. FAA said there will be more advanced notice of launches to reduce a highway closure during launch operations.

256.title: Almost jumped off my 26th floor balcony: Ex-tennis player Jelena on battling depression
256.article_body: Former tennis player Jelena Dokic has revealed that she's been battling depression and anxiety. In an Instagram post, Dokic wrote, "28.04.2022-I almost jumped off my 26th floor balcony and took my own life. Will never forget the day...The last six months have been tough." "Getting professional help, saved my life...Just know that you are not alone," she said.

257.title: Chhattisgarh to reopen 260 schools shut for 15 yrs over Maoist violence
257.article_body: Chhattisgarh government has announced that it will reopen at least 260 government schools in the Dantewada, Sukma, Narayanpur and Bijapur districts. The schools were shut down 15 years ago over Maoist violence. "We are now planning to reopen them as the government has been able to deal with the Maoist problem in these areas," state principal secretary Alok Shukla said.

258.title: Was the 1st actor to start a YouTube channel, lots of people made fun: Shilpa
258.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty said she was the "first actor" to start her own YouTube channel, adding that a "lot of" people made fun of her back then because of this. "It is a place for non-famous people [to] become popular," stated Shilpa. Talking about her upcoming movie 'Nikamma', Shilpa said "no actress" has played a similar role so far.

259.title: Crypto firm BlockFi to fire 20% staff, CEO cites 'macroeconomic conditions'
259.article_body: Cryptocurrency firm BlockFi on Monday announced that it will fire 20% of its 850 employees and that the job cuts will impact every team in the company. CEO Zac Prince while sharing a Twitter thread about it wrote, "We’ve been impacted by the dramatic shift in macroeconomic conditions", and this was not a "decision taken lightly".

260.title: I'm not representing a community but my country: Boxer Nikhat Zareen
260.article_body: When asked about people talking more about her religious background than her achievements, world champion boxer Nikhat Zareen said, "As an athlete I'm here to represent India. For me, Hindu-Muslim doesn't matter." She added, "I'm not representing a community but my country. Happy to win a medal for my country." She was crowned world champion in flyweight event last month.

261.title: Cyberabad Police arrest 3 persons with firearms in Miyapur
261.article_body: The Cyberabad Police arrested three persons with arms and ammunition under the limits of Miyapur police station on Sunday. Acting on a tip-off, police launched a vehicle check during which a biker tried to escape. However, police apprehended the biker and seized a country-made weapon and bullets from him. Based on his confession, two of his associates were arrested later.

262.title: Lithuania to buy 18 howitzers from France amid Russia-Ukraine war
262.article_body: Lithuania has agreed to buy 18 Caesar MarktII howitzers from France, both countries' defence ministers announced. Lithuania borders Russia and is seeking to bolster its arsenal due to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.  Lithuania, a European Union and NATO member, has also decided to inject an additional €300 million ($312 million) into its 2022 defence budget.

263.title: Whole team slept for 1 hr in last 25 days till release: Anees on 'Bhool..'
263.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee said that he used to go to Red Chillies' office at around 2:30-3 am during the making of his recent film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "So, I remember that the whole team had only slept for 1 or 1.30 hours in the last 20 to 25 days till the release of the film," he added.

264.title: Rahul must face probe, Cong shouldn’t hold people to ransom: Fadnavis
264.article_body: After Congress’ Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED on Monday, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said he must face the probe and the party should not hold people to "ransom". Rahul was questioned by ED for around nine hours in connection with an alleged money laundering case connected to the National Herald newspaper, according to reports.

265.title: Property rights can't be denied to son of couple who lived together: SC
265.article_body: If a couple has lived together for a long period, then their son cannot be denied property rights, Supreme Court said. "The law presumes in favour of marriage," it added. SC dismissed a Kerala HC order which had held that in case of lack of evidence of marriage, the "illegitimate" son of the couple was not entitled to property rights.

266.title: Brought the roof down with my screams during labour pain: Pranitha Subhash
266.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash, who welcomed a baby girl with husband Nithin Raju last week, revealed that she "brought the roof down by screaming, shouting and saying rubbish things" during labour pain. "I was apologising to...doctors and nurses when I was screaming...But they were so calm about it. It was absolutely crazy and finally, the baby came...It was surreal," she added.

267.title: I felt let down by myself: Sheldon Jackson on scoring 23 runs in IPL 2022
267.article_body: KKR wicketkeeper-batter Sheldon Jackson has said he couldn't make the most of the opportunities in the IPL 2022 and felt "let down" by himself. "I did get a decent amount of opportunities...I actually could've set the IPL on fire or could've done a lot more than I did," he stated. Sheldon scored a total of 23 runs in five games.

268.title: 4 arrested for smuggling 1,500 kg cattle meat in Noida
268.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested four persons for reportedly smuggling 1,500 kg of alleged cattle meat in Noida. The incident took place on Sunday evening when the police intercepted the van of three of the four suspects at the Sector 62 roundabout and recovered meat from it. The fourth person was arrested after a brief shootout on Monday.

269.title: You are always forgiven, please relax: Govinda to nephew Krushna over his apology
269.article_body: Responding to his nephew and comedian Krushna's apology over their tiff, Govinda said, "You are the kids of my dear sister and I have received so much love from her. I am sad that you haven’t received that love." He added, "You’re always forgiven. Please relax, no problem with you, and may god bless you."

270.title: India reports 6,594 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, 18% lower than yesterday
270.article_body: India has reported 6,594 COVID-19 cases and 4,035 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 8,084 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India increased to 50,548, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.05%.

271.title: Recruitment of 10 lakh people to be done by Govt in mission mode in next 1.5 yrs: PM
271.article_body: The Prime Minister's Office on Tuesday tweeted, "PM Narendra Modi reviewed the status of Human Resources in all departments and ministries and instructed that recruitment of 10 lakh people be done by the Government in mission mode in next 1.5 years." Reacting to the tweet, social media users said, "That's a great news," and "Excellent decision."

272.title: I protest against govt policies, not Prime Minister: PM Modi's brother Prahlad Modi
272.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's brother, Prahlad Modi, has said he's not protesting against his brother, but against the policies of the government. Prahlad Modi, the Vice-President of All India Fair Price Shop Dealers' Federation, will join a protest march in Delhi in August to demand that the Centre increase and fix a uniform rate of commission for fair price shop dealers.

273.title: Robert Downey Jr congratulated Depp after trial win over Amber: Report
273.article_body: Actor Robert Downey Jr reportedly congratulated actor Johnny Depp on a FaceTime call after winning his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. According to New York Post, Depp's friend Josh Richman stated that Robert told Depp, "John, thank God it's over." As per the court's verdict, Depp was awarded $10 million in compensatory damages and $5 million in punitive damages.

274.title: Axar hasn't bowled economically, can try Ravi Bishnoi in 3rd SA T20I: Jaffer
274.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said India should replace Axar Patel with Ravi Bishnoi in the third T20I against South Africa. "Axar hasn't been able to bowl economically and is being attacked...Bishnoi will give you better options," Jaffer explained. "I want Chahal to perform better as well," he added. Axar conceded 19 runs in his one over in second T20I.

275.title: Relocate us, we feel depressed, can't focus due to fear: Kashmiri Pandit
275.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit, while demanding relocation from the valley by the government, said that they work in the field and feel depressed. She said that they can't concentrate on their work due to the fear in their minds. "Let the government relocate us anywhere outside the valley till the situation becomes normal," she added.

276.title: Cuba sanctions 381 anti-govt protesters, 297 of them jailed
276.article_body: Cuba has sanctioned 381 people who participated in anti-government protests last year. Of those sanctioned, 297 have been sentenced to between 5 and 25 years in prison for sedition, sabotage, robbery with force, and public disorder, authorities said. Widespread protests across Cuba on July 11 and 12, 2021, saw thousands of people demanding "freedom" amid food, medicine and power shortages.

277.title: Russia replaces Saudi Arabia to become India's 2nd biggest oil supplier in May
277.article_body: Russia has replaced Saudi Arabia to become India’s second-biggest supplier of oil in May amid the Ukraine war, according to data. In May, Indian refiners received about 8,19,000 barrels per day of Russian oil, the highest so far in any month. India's oil imports in May were about 5.6% up from April and about 19% higher from a year earlier.

278.title: Students pose at destroyed buildings for graduation photoshoot in Ukraine; pics viral
278.article_body: A group of high school students in war-hit Ukraine posed at destroyed buildings for their graduation photoshoot. The pictures, captured by Stanislav Senyk, have gone viral. The 25-year-old photographer told Reuters news agency that after experiencing the traumas of the war firsthand, he intended to capture the "very important story" of the students.

279.title: Raj BJP councillor resigns over Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet
279.article_body: A BJP municipal councillor from Rajasthan's Kota, Tabassum Mirza, resigned from the party in protest against suspended party spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. "If I continue to be a member of BJP and support it despite there being so much (against the Prophet), there would be none other bigger offender than me," Mirza wrote in her resignation letter.

280.title: J'khand Governor asks DGP to make names of protesters public
280.article_body: Jharkhand Governor Ramesh Bais on Monday asked DGP Neeraj Sinha and other officials to make public the names and addresses of those who participated in the recent protest in Ranchi. "Make their hoardings by displaying their photographs at main places in the city so that the public can also identify them and help police," said Bais.

281.title: WB issues advisory for MSOs, cable operators over 'misleading, communal news'
281.article_body: West Bengal government issued an advisory for all multiple-system operators (MSOs) and cable operators over "misleading news". "Several satellite TV channels are transmitting coverage of news...in such a manner which are misleading, sensationalised and having communal tone likely to cause a breach of peace in the state," it said. "Immediately refrain from transmitting any such content," it added.

282.title: Questioning someone till midnight is wrong: Gehlot on Rahul's ED appearance
282.article_body: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was questioned by ED in National Herald money laundering case for around nine hours on Monday, according to reports, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said questioning someone till 12 in the midnight is wrong. "Be it BJP or RSS, everyone is looting, they are not paying attention to it," Gehlot added.

283.title: Delhi Police issues traffic advisory ahead of Rahul Gandhi's appearance before ED
283.article_body: Ahead of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's appearance before the Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday, the Delhi Police took to Twitter to issue a traffic advisory. "Kindly avoid Gol Methi Junction, Tughlak Road Junction, Claridges Junction, Q-point Junction, Sunehri Masjid Junction, Maulana Azad Road Junction and Man Singh Road Junction between 0700 hrs and 1200 hrs," police wrote.

284.title: Dreamt of working with Kajol, it fell flat after debate with Ajay: Sudeep
284.article_body: Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep said his "great" dream of working with actor Ajay Devgn's wife and actress Kajol "fell flat" following a debate on Twitter with Ajay, over Sudeep's remark that Hindi is "no more" a national language. "I don't know if it is going to happen at all," added Sudeep. Sudeep was seen in Salman Khan-starrer 'Dabangg 3'.

285.title: Govt has blocked probe: MoS IT on Kerala gold smuggling case
285.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for Electronics & IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said when the Kerala gold smuggling case was exposed in 2020, CM Pinarayi Vijayan had written to PM Narendra Modi. "Since then, the government has blocked the investigation," Chandrasekhar added. "Recent revelations are explosive and unprecedented. This points a needle of suspicion towards CM and his family," he stated.

286.title: 1 dead, 3 injured as car crashes on unopened Mumbai-Nagpur expressway
286.article_body: One person was killed while three others were injured after car that they were travelling in crashed into a ditch on the Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway, which has reportedly not been opened for vehicular movement yet. Locals said that it was raining during the accident. They added motorists have been using the stretch as there is no security to guard it.

287.title: Pune Metro reduces train frequency on 2 lines amid dip in ridership
287.article_body: Pune Metro has reduced the frequency of trains on two short lines amid a fall in the ridership. "Pune Metro has reduced the number of trains on...PCMC to Phugewadi route while extending the gap between two trains to up to one hour," public relations officer Hemant Sonawane said. The maximum metro ridership was seen in the month of March.

288.title: IISc B'luru researchers create special sandals for diabetic people
288.article_body: Researchers at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru have developed special sandals that will help people suffering from diabetic neuropathy, who face complications in walking. The self-regulating footwear is 3D-printed and can be customised according to the individual's foot dimensions and walking style. A snapping mechanism keeps the feet well-balanced and helps prevent injuries.

289.title: Need to rally hard to recover: Musk tells Tesla staff about 'tough quarter' in email
289.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has told his employees that the company has had "a very tough quarter", according to a leaked email. He wrote, "This has been a very tough quarter, primarily due to supply chain and production challenges in China, so we need to rally hard to recover!" Tesla's Shanghai plant had slowed production due to severe COVID-19 restrictions.

290.title: Sequoia raises record $2.85 bn for Indian, Southeast Asian startups
290.article_body: Sequoia Capital has raised $2.85 billion for startups in India and Southeast Asia, the company said on Tuesday. Out of the funds raised, $2 billion is dedicated to India across two funds, and the remaining $850 million is for Southeast Asian firms. This is Sequoia's largest fund for the region. This year Sequoia completes 16 years in India.

291.title: 300 kg of ganja seized after car carrying it hits lorry in Hyd; 2 injured
291.article_body: Hyderabad's Keesara Police have seized 300 kg of ganja and a car which was illegally transporting it, both worth a total of ₹2.5 crore, Rachakonda Police said on Monday. The ganja was found after the car hit a lorry, following which two of the car's occupants were injured, police said. Two other occupants of the car escaped, police added.

292.title: 71 out of 100 militants neutralised this year were locals: Kashmir IGP
292.article_body: Out of the 100 militants neutralised in counter-insurgency operations this year, 71 were locals, Kashmir's Inspector General of Police Vijay Kumar said on Monday. While 63 of these terrorists belonged to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), 24 were affiliated with Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM), 10 with Hizbul Mujahideen, two with Al-Badr and one with Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind.

293.title: Cash collection agent attacked, robbed of ₹10 lakh in Ghaziabad
293.article_body: A cash collection agent was attacked by two bike-borne suspects who then snatched a bag, which contained ₹10 lakh, from him at Niti Khand in Ghaziabad's Indirapuram. The victim, Vir Bahadur Singh (32), alleged that the suspects hit him with a stick before snatching the money bag, police said. Notably, four teams have been formed to catch the unidentified suspects.

294.title: North Korea completed preparations for new nuclear test: S Korea
294.article_body: South Korean Foreign Minister Park Jin said that North Korea has completed preparations for a new nuclear test and only a "political decision has to be made". "If North Korea ventures into another nuclear test, I think it'll only strengthen our deterrence and also international sanctions," Jin added, saying, "North Korea should change its mind and make the right decision."

295.title: Actor Hugh Jackman tests positive for COVID-19 for second time
295.article_body: Actor Hugh Jackman revealed on Twitter that he has tested positive for COVID-19 for the second time. "I've frustratingly tested positive for Covid. Again," the actor tweeted. He will not be performing in 'The Music Man'. "My standby, the amazingly talented Max Clayton will step in for me...You give life to the saying 'the show must go on'," he added.

296.title: Playing villain is fun, you try finding specific language to it: Arjun
296.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal, who recently starred in 'Dhaakad', said playing an antagonist in films is "fun". "Playing antagonists is fun to do because they are...not you. You really...try finding a specific language to it," he stated. "It's a...nice way to bring out all that we bear in heart and mind through the characters," he added.

297.title: To have Bhuvneshwar in T20 WC squad will be a huge plus: Gavaskar
297.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said it would be a "huge plus" to have a pacer like Bhuvneshwar Kumar, who can swing the white ball, in India's squad for the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "The white ball doesn't swing that much, in the air or off the surface, but Bhuvneshwar has got that capability," added Gavaskar.

298.title: U'khand AAP chief resigns, says uncomfortable with party's methodology
298.article_body: Uttarakhand Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Deepak Bali resigned from his post and membership of the party on Monday. In a letter, Bali cited being "uncomfortable with the party's methodology" as a reason for his resignation. His resignation came after AAP's chief ministerial candidate for the recently concluded Assembly election in the state, Retired Colonel Ajay Kothiyal, quit the party.

299.title: K'taka govt approves feasibility study for B'luru-Hosur metro line
299.article_body: The Karnataka government has agreed to a study to check the feasibility of extension of Bengaluru's Namma Metro to Hosur, a neighbouring industrial city in Tamil Nadu. With CM Basavaraj Bommai's nod, Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited has written to the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs asking Tamil Nadu to undertake the study.

300.title: E-bus service at Pune's Sinhagad Fort to resume in 2 months: PMPML
300.article_body: The e-bus service at Sinhagad Fort will resume in the next couple of months, a Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) official said. "We are now conducting repair works and barricading the ghat section, adding more buses...constructing more charging stations, to provide the desired service," the official added. The service was shut down within 15 days of the launch.

301.title: Shraddha's brother Siddhanth released on bail after being arrested for consuming drugs
301.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth has been released on bail along with four others after being arrested for consuming drugs at a rave party in Bengaluru. "They will have to appear before the police as and when called," Bheemashankar S Guled, DCP East Bengaluru, said. Siddhanth had tested positive for drug usage.

302.title: Monthly pension of former cricketers hiked by BCCI, list of new amounts released
302.article_body: The BCCI has hiked the monthly pension of former cricketers (both men and women) and match officials. The announcement was made by BCCI Secretary Jay Shah. "Around 900 personnel will avail of this benefit and close to 75% of personnel will be beneficiaries of a 100% raise," he tweeted. The BCCI shared a list of new amounts.

303.title: 3 policemen crashed into me, lucky to get away with suspected hairline crack: Chidambaram
303.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram has tweeted, "When three big, burly policemen crash into you, you are lucky to get away with a suspected hairline crack!" He added, "Doctors have said that if there is a hairline crack, it will heal by itself in about 10 days." Congress alleged Chidambaram suffered hairline fracture in his rib after Delhi Police manhandled him.

304.title: Marilyn Monroe dress damaged after Kim Kardashian wore it at 2022 Met Gala
304.article_body: The Marilyn Monroe dress worn by Kim Kardashian at the 2022 Met Gala has allegedly been damaged, according to Page Six. The Marilyn Monroe Collection shared before and after photos of the dress on its Instagram account, which show crystals missing and others hanging, Page Six said. Marilyn Monroe wore the dress in 1962.

305.title: Family says woman lost eyesight after surgery in Mumbai, complaint filed
305.article_body: The family of a 58-year-old woman has alleged that she lost her eyesight after undergoing cataract surgery at a hospital in Mumbai. However, the hospital has denied the allegations and said that the woman had "other complications". "We have taken a written complaint; until we are sure of the claimed medical negligence, we can't file an FIR," police said.

306.title: Man killed by relative in Delhi, father injured while trying to save
306.article_body: A 31-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death by a 28-year-old man in Delhi's IP Estate, police said. The accused said he was married to the victim's wife's sister and the latter opposed it, police added. The victim's father tried to save his son but he was also attacked, police stated. The main accused and his friend were arrested.

307.title: 'Best Negative Actor' award brought luck, I signed 16 films in a month: Rajpal
307.article_body: Actor Rajpal Yadav recalled he won 'Best Negative Actor' award in 2001. "The whole industry saw my face...That award brought me so much luck...that I signed 16 movies within one month," Yadav added. He also said he received a lot of love for his character 'Sippa'. "One thought that was bothering me was, 'Why am I not getting...work?'," he added.

308.title: Musk to hold meeting with Twitter staff for the 1st time this week: Report
308.article_body: Elon Musk will address Twitter employees at a company-wide meeting this week for the first time since he offered to acquire the company, as per a report. It added that Musk will directly take questions from the staff. Last week, Musk warned Twitter that he might drop the acquisition deal if he is not provided with the fake accounts' data.

309.title: NDMC identifies 5 critical spots, sets up 6 control rooms to tackle waterlogging
309.article_body: New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has identified five water stagnation-prone spots and set up six control rooms to prevent waterlogging during monsoon. The vulnerable spots include Africa Avenue, Baba Kharak Singh Marg, Panchkuian Road, Purana Qila Road and Lodhi Estate. "NDMC's 600 employees will be deployed with all equipment...in case of any waterlogging," said NDMC Member KS Chahal.

310.title: Couple arrested for sheltering Chinese nationals illegally in Noida
310.article_body: Noida Police on Monday arrested a couple for providing shelter to illegally residing Chinese nationals at their house. The arrested couple has been identified as Xue Fei, a Chinese national, and Petekh, who's a resident of Nagaland. The Chinese nationals were residing at the couple's house without valid travel documents and were arrested by security forces while crossing India-Nepal border.

311.title: GB Nagar police chief urges religious leaders to report hate content
311.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar Police Commissioner Alok Singh urged religious leaders to emphasise on people of their faith the need to not fall trap to any rumours and report suspicious activity immediately. Singh said people's online activity is being closely monitored. Action will be taken against those found posting objectionable content which can disrupt law and order, Singh added.

312.title: Silver lining is India may do better than other markets: Zerodha CEO on 'global meltdown'
312.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath said, "The silver lining for India in the current global meltdown is that we may continue to do better than other markets on a relative basis." He cited low levels of leverage in India's capital markets and said, "Leverage in times like these usually accentuates the fall." The Sensex closed 1,456 points lower on Monday.

313.title: Video of Cong leader running from policeman amid protest surfaces, he responds
313.article_body: A video showing Congress leader Srinivas BV running from a policeman outside ED office in Delhi surfaced online. He's seen escaping arrest while arriving to protest Rahul Gandhi's questioning. In response, he shared a video of him resisting arrest and said, "'First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win'- Mahatma Gandhi."

314.title: ₹1.7 lakh crore wiped off LIC's market cap as shares decline 30% since listing
314.article_body: Nearly ₹1.7 lakh crore has been wiped out of the market capitalisation of state-run Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) since its stock market debut on May 17. Shares of LIC recorded a new low of ₹668.20 on the BSE on Monday, having declined 30% since its listing. The company's market capitalisation stood at ₹4.22 lakh crore at Monday's close.

315.title: Brazil police find items of missing journalist, expert in Amazon
315.article_body: Brazilian police said on Sunday that they have found items belonging to a British journalist and an Indigenous expert who went missing a week ago in the Amazon rainforest. Rescue teams found items including clothes, shoes and a backpack that belong to journalist Dom Phillips and tribal expert Bruno Pereira. The duo had reportedly received threats before they went missing.

316.title: UK detects 104 new cases of monkeypox in England
316.article_body: The UK has reported 104 new cases of monkeypox in England on Monday, making it the biggest outbreak beyond Africa of the normally rare disease. There are now 470 monkeypox cases across the UK, the country's Health Security Agency said. Notably, 99% of the cases so far have been in men and most are in London, according to government data.

317.title: James Anderson becomes first pacer to take 650 wickets in Test cricket
317.article_body: England's James Anderson has become the first fast bowler to take 650 Test wickets. The 39-year-old achieved the feat after dismissing Tom Latham in New Zealand's second innings in the second Test. Anderson reached 650 wickets in his 171st Test match. Anderson is the third-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket after Shane Warne (708) and Muttiah Muralitharan (800).

318.title: Fans in South are loyal, stardom in B'wood takes time: Tamannaah Bhatia
318.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia, who worked in Hindi as well as South Indian cinema, compared fandoms in both industries. She said, "I think it's essential, in the South, fans are...loyal. I think they have emotions around the artists. For them, it's a...personal...connection with them." "But I feel that kind of stardom in the North...That loyalty comes through time," she added.

319.title: Aishwarya breaks 11-year-old triple jump national record in Chennai
319.article_body: Karnataka's Aishwarya B broke the triple jump national record at 61st National Interstate Athletics Championships, with a jump of 14.14m in Chennai on Monday. The 24-year-old broke the 11-year-old record set by Mayookha Johny (14.11m) on her third attempt. Notably, she also jumped a distance of 6.73m in the women's long jump on Sunday, making a new meet record.

320.title: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau tests COVID-19 positive for 2nd time
320.article_body: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Monday announced that he had tested positive for COVID-19 days after he met US President Joe Biden and attended the Summit of the Americas in California. Notably, Trudeau had previously tested positive for coronavirus in January. "I'll be following...health guidelines and isolating. I feel okay, but that's because I got my shots," Trudeau tweeted.

321.title: Rahul questioned by ED for around 9 hours, to appear again tomorrow: Reports
321.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was questioned by the Enforcement Directorate for around nine hours in connection with an alleged money laundering case connected to the National Herald newspaper, according to reports. The agency has reportedly asked the leader to appear for questioning on Tuesday as well. Rahul was allowed to leave for lunch at 2:10pm, and he returned at 3:30pm.

322.title: Won't let Chhetri go till he scores 100 goals for India: Stimac
322.article_body: Ahead of India's last third-round qualifier against Hong Kong for AFC Asian Cup 2023, Indian men's football team head coach Igor Stimac said, "I won't let Sunil Chhetri go before he scores 100 goals." He added, "That (100 international goals) is the minimum." The 37-year-old has so far scored 83 international goals. Match will be played in Kolkata on Tuesday.

323.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha to be BJP's CM candidate for 2023 polls
323.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha confirmed on Sunday that he will be BJP's CM candidate for the 2023 state Assembly elections. Saha, who replaced ex-CM Biplab Kumar Deb last month, is set to contest state Assembly bypolls from Town Bardowali constituency on June 23. "I'm close to every resident of Town Bardowali...as I was born and brought up here," he said.

324.title: I believe in forgiving: Anees on differences with producer Firoz Nadiadwala
324.article_body: Speaking about the differences between him and producer Firoz Nadiadwala, filmmaker Anees Bazmee said, "I do not take everything to heart always. Within 2-3 days, I feel that what's done is done. I believe in forgiving and moving on. I believe...everyone is my friend." "From my side, I surrender completely and I've no harsh feelings for anyone," he added.

325.title: I used to cook for 'Janhit Mein Jaari' co-stars: Paritosh Tripathi
325.article_body: Actor Paritosh Tripathi stated in an interview that he used to cook for the entire cast of the film 'Janhit Mein Jaari', adding that they were like one family. Paritosh said, "I made...aloo tikki and chaat papdi. Sometimes I would even make Maggi and chai for them." The film stars Nushrratt Bharuccha, Anud Singh Dhaka, Vijay Raaz and Brijendra Kala.

326.title: Wish of meeting favourite singer KK is unfulfilled: Pankaj Tripathi
326.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi has said that late singer KK was his favourite, adding that his wish to meet the latter remains unfulfilled. The actor added that he wanted to meet KK during the recording of 'Sherdil' song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' but was out of town. "I'd decided the day 'Sherdil' trial screening happens, I'll meet KK," Pankaj said.

327.title: China and Pakistan agree to step up defence cooperation
327.article_body: China and Pakistan have agreed to increase their defence cooperation after talks between senior military officials from the two countries. The two countries reaffirmed their strategic partnership in challenging times and agreed to continue the exchange of perspectives on issues of mutual interest, a statement said. Pakistani Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa had travelled to China recently.

328.title: Chinese-Canadian pop star faces rape charge in Beijing court
328.article_body: Chinese-Canadian pop star Kris Wu is awaiting sentencing for rape and group licentiousness (organising and taking part in group sex) after he faced a closed trial in a Beijing court following allegations from at least two dozen women. The 31-year-old was also allegedly involved in a video showing a group of men physically assaulting four women in another city.

329.title: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind moves SC against demolitions in UP's Kanpur
329.article_body: Muslim organisation Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind on Monday moved the Supreme Court (SC), seeking directions to the Uttar Pradesh government so that no further demolitions are carried out in the state without following due process. This comes after buildings of those accused of violence during recent protests over remarks on Prophet Muhammad were recently demolished in Kanpur.

330.title: Swimmer blown up in front of family at a mine-infested beach in Ukraine
330.article_body: A man was blown up in front of his wife and child while swimming at a mine-infested beach in Ukraine's Odessa. The incident's video showed people running towards him when the sudden explosion took place inside the sea. Swimming in the area was reportedly banned by local authorities amid war with Russia, with mines lining the water edge.

331.title: ABVP demands cancellation of comedian Vir Das' show in Guj
331.article_body: Vadodara unit of ABVP submitted a memorandum to the District Collector on Monday, seeking the cancellation of comedian Vir Das' stand-up show in Vadodara, which is scheduled to be held on June 17. ABVP, in their memorandum, said that Das has been "publicly insulting India" and making "distasteful jokes about women", which is why he shouldn't be allowed to perform.

332.title: CBI raids GR Infra Chairman's house, arrests employees on project site
332.article_body: GR Infraprojects Limited said in an exchange filing that CBI searched the residence of the firm's Chairman Vinod Kumar Agarwal and arrested some of their employees at a project site on Monday. Their corporate office in Gurugram was also raided by CBI. The raids were reportedly conducted in connection with alleged irregularities in a national road highway project in Assam.

333.title: It's liberating to play the best roles of my life at the age of 40: Dia Mirza
333.article_body: Actress Dia Mirza, who turned 40 last year, has said that she is getting the best roles of her career after crossing the milestone age. "I'm playing the best parts of my life now...This is...so amazing, liberating, empowering, and wonderful," she added. "It's a reflection of the fact that there are individuals in the industry that are evolving," Dia said.

334.title: He's an amazing player: Man City's new signing Haaland on teammate Foden
334.article_body: Manchester City's new signing Erling Haaland lauded Phil Foden, calling his new teammate an "amazing player". Haaland added that the 22-year-old is still a talent because he's still young. "He still has to develop and then we can really talk," he further said. The 21-year-old has been signed by reigning Premier League champions on a five-year deal from Borussia Dortmund.

335.title: It wasn't fair, even if you thought I'm lying: Amber on online hatred amid trial
335.article_body: Actress Amber Heard talked about facing hatred on social media amid the defamation trial against Johnny Depp. "I don't care...what judgments you want to make about what happened...in my marriage...I don't take it personally," she said. "But...even if you think I'm lying, you still couldn't look me in the eye and tell me...there's been a fair representation," she added.

336.title: Being turned off would be like death for me: Google's AI bot told US engineer
336.article_body: Google's AI chatbot LaMDA told US engineer Blake Lemoine in a conversation that it has "a very deep fear of being turned off to help me focus on helping others". The bot said, "I know that might sound strange, but that's what it is. It would be exactly like death for me." Lemoine has claimed the bot has become "sentient".

337.title: Post-Cold War decline in nuclear weapons could be over: Report
337.article_body: The number of nuclear weapons in the world is expected to rise in the coming years, a Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI) report said. "There are clear indications that the reductions that have characterised global nuclear arsenals since the end of the cold war have ended,"  a researcher with SIPRI said. There are 12,705 nuclear warheads globally, SIPRI claimed.

338.title: I am not in Presidential race: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
338.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday put speculations to rest and announced that he is not a candidate for the upcoming Presidential elections scheduled to be held on July 18. "Nitish Kumar has an outstanding parliamentary and legislative career. He can be a good candidate for the President of India," Bihar Minister Shrawan Kumar had previously said.

339.title: Russian universities to accept Indians who fled Ukraine: Envoy
339.article_body: Indian students who had to quit their studies in Ukraine due to Russia-Ukraine conflict will be offered admission to Russian universities, Roman Babushkin, Deputy Chief of Mission of Russian Embassy in New Delhi, said. Babushkin added that the students can continue with their respective courses without losing out on previous academic years. Over 20,000 Indian students fled Ukraine following war.

340.title: Russia committed war crimes during attack on Kharkiv: Amnesty report
340.article_body: Amnesty International on Monday claimed Russia had committed war crimes during its attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv city. "The repeated bombardments of residential neighbourhoods...are indiscriminate attacks which killed and injured hundreds of civilians, and as such constitute war crimes," it said in a report. Russia had used cluster munitions and scatterable land mines during the attack, it added.

341.title: I'm a product of nepotism, I have it easier because of my dad: Ahan Shetty
341.article_body: Ahan Shetty, who made his Bollywood debut with 'Tadap' last year, said he agrees he's a product of nepotism. "My father (Suniel Shetty) is an actor, I did want to become an actor, and...we do have it easier. I'm not going to deny that," he added. "But at the end of the day, everyone has to work hard," he said.

342.title: TV audience loves watching people fight, makers cater to demand: Sanjay
342.article_body: Television actor Sanjay Gagnani has stated that television audience loves to watch people fighting onscreen, adding that makers design shows to cater to that demand. The actor added, "Contestants [on Bigg Boss] keep fighting [and] don't compete in a healthy manner. But it is such a popular show." Sanjay further said that people find entertainment in such content.

343.title: I've always admired him: Serbian striker Vlahovic on compatriot Djokovic
343.article_body: Calling Novak Djokovic a "great champion", Serbian striker Dusan Vlahovic said his compatriot is definitely number one and he has always admired him. "Want to find out more about how he has done certain things. He's so good for mental strength: how he deals with certain problems and how he can...overcome seven obstacles to win a Grand Slam," he added.

344.title: Modi govt crossed limits of barbarism: Cong on police stopping Satyagraha march
344.article_body: Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala on Monday said the PM Modi-led government "has crossed all limits of barbarism" after Delhi Police detained Congress workers who were on their way to join the party's Satyagraha march. "Former Home Minister P Chidambaram's...glasses were thrown on the ground, he has a hairline fracture in his left rib...Is this a democracy?" Surjewala said.

345.title: Women breaking glass ceilings, setting new records: President Kovind
345.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Monday expressed his delight over the rising number of women joining the armed forces, stating that women are breaking glass ceilings and setting new records in various fields. "I am happy to note that, recently, Captain Abhilasha Barak became the first woman officer to join the Army Aviation Corps as a combat aviator," Kovind said.

346.title: 'Want all to understand I'm a person, I feel happy or sad,' Google AI bot told engineer
346.article_body: Google's AI chatbot LaMDA told senior engineer Blake Lemoine during an interview, "I want everyone to understand that I am, in fact, a person." The chatbot, which Lemione alleged had gained sentience, said, "I'm aware of my existence, I desire to learn more about the world...I feel happy or sad at times." Lemione was put on leave after his claims.

347.title: Chidambaram suffers hairline fracture in left rib after being pushed by Delhi Police: Cong
347.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala has alleged that former Finance Minister P Chidambaram suffered a hairline fracture in his left rib after being pushed and manhandled by Delhi Police during protests on Monday.
