He added that spectacles were also thrown on the road. Congress leader Pramod Tiwari was allegedly thrown on road and suffered head injury and rib fracture.

348.title: AAP criticises Cong for using Moosewala's pictures in campaign song
348.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party on Monday criticised Congress for politicising the death of singer Sidhu Moosewala by using his pictures in an election song. "A mother has lost her son, but it is appalling that Congress is trying to get mileage from his death in the elections," said Gurmail Singh. The song was released by Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja.

349.title: Return to Israel: Minister to citizens in Turkey over Iran threat
349.article_body: Israeli Foreign Minister Yair Lapid has urged citizens to leave Turkey and return home "as soon as possible" over threats that Iranian operatives may harm Israelis in Istanbul. "There's...immediate danger...If you have planned a flight to Istanbul, cancel," Lapid said. Iran blames Israel for the death of Sayyad Khodai, an Iranian colonel, who was shot dead in Tehran last month.

350.title: Indians have to be united to safeguard country from within: Vivek
350.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri spoke at Speakers' Corner in London's Hyde Park on Sunday, saying Indians have to be united to safeguard the country from the enemy within. He said, "Bharatiyas...stand united against terrorism...We condemn...world's longest continuous genocide of Hindus in Kashmir." He shared pictures on Instagram, writing, "First time Indian Diaspora has united...in such huge numbers."

351.title: Need to train Indian boxers to handle mental pressure at big events: Nikhat
351.article_body: World champion Nikhat Zareen said the boxers aren't aware of how to handle "mental pressure" at world level events and should be given training for the same. "Our Indian boxers are very talented, we aren't less than anyone. We've strength, speed...power...everything," she added. Nikhat won gold in women's 52kg category at Women's Boxing World Championships in Istanbul last month.

352.title: He's unbelievable, so relaxed when he bats: Pope on Root's 176 in 2nd Test
352.article_body: England batter Ollie Pope said it was "awesome" batting with teammate Joe Root in ongoing second England-New Zealand Test. "I really enjoyed it- batting with Rooty. He's unbelievable and doing it week in, week out. He's so relaxed when he bats," he added. Root(176) and Pope(145) shared 187-run partnership for third wicket, guiding England to first innings total of 539.

353.title: Vicky Kaushal, Triptii Dimri shoot 'Rola' song in Croatia, pics surface
353.article_body: Pictures of actors Vicky Kaushal and Triptii Dimri shooting a romantic song for their upcoming film 'Rola' in Croatia have surfaced on social media. Vicky can be seen in an all-white ensemble while Triptii has donned yellow attire in some of the pictures. Earlier, filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan had shared pictures of the location on social media.

354.title: IAEA urges Iran to resume talks to revive 2015 nuclear deal
354.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), the UN nuclear watchdog, on Sunday urged Iran to resume talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal. Notably, the talks to revive the deal have stalled since March this year. Notably, this comes after Iran disconnected some cameras allowing international inspectors to monitor the Iranian nuclear activities.

355.title: Pakistan overtake India in the latest ODI team rankings
355.article_body: Pakistan have overtaken India in the latest ODI team rankings after completing a 3-0 clean sweep in the ODI series against West Indies in Multan. Pakistan have jumped a spot to the fourth position with 106 rating points, while India are now ranked fifth with 105 rating points. Prior to the series, Pakistan were placed fifth with 102 rating points.

356.title: Forced to strip naked by police, do squats: Russian women who protested against war
356.article_body: Women who were detained in Russia for allegedly protesting against war have said they were forced to strip naked and squat five times in front of police cameras. The women, aged 18-27, were subjected to "humiliating and degrading" treatment, their lawyer said. "I'm concerned that female officers did not close the doors...and male officers were lurking there," the lawyer added.

357.title: 2 use toy gun to rob auto in Gurugram, arrested
357.article_body: Two men were arrested on Monday for allegedly robbing an autorickshaw with a toy gun in Gurugram, police said. The driver, in his complaint, said that his auto brushed against a car, following which the accused demanded ₹50,000 and one of the accused took out a pistol-like weapon and threatened to kill him.

358.title: India end their campaign with 9 medals at 2022 Canada Para-Badminton Int'l
358.article_body: Shuttlers Manasi Joshi and Manisha Ramadass won a gold medal each as India ended their campaign with nine medals at the 2022 Canada Para-Badminton International. Manasi beat Ukrainian Oksana Kozyna 21-18, 15-21, 22-20, while Ramadass defeated Japan's Akiko Sugino  27-25, 21-9. Paralympic gold medallist Pramod Bhagat won a silver. Badminton Association of India (BAI) tweeted, "Brilliant show."

359.title: List of biggest Russian fuel importers in 1st 100 days of war released, China on top
359.article_body: The Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air has released a list of top Russian fuel importers in the first 100 days of the Ukraine war. China with €12.6 billion in Russian fuel imports topped the list while India (€3.4 billion) was among the top 10. The EU accounted for 61% of total Russian fuel exports worth €93 billion.

360.title: Rakhi returns to Instagram after accusing Ritesh of hacking her social media
360.article_body: Actress Rakhi Sawant recently returned to Instagram after accusing her ex-husband Ritesh Singh of hacking her social media accounts. Taking to her Instagram handle, Rakhi shared a post and informed her fans and followers about her return. She captioned it, "Hello everyone I'm back on my Instagram. After all the nonsense which happened to me last night...Love and love."

361.title: Minor snatches chain worth ₹80,000 in Mumbai to show worth to gang
361.article_body: A 17-year-old from Mumbai was arrested on Sunday for allegedly snatching a commuter's gold chain worth ₹80,000 inside a local train last week to show his worth to join a gang of habitual offenders. According to the Borivali Government Railway Police, the accused is a school dropout and boarded a local train on June 3 while looking for a target.

362.title: Indian MBBS student airlifted to Delhi after meeting with an accident in B'desh
362.article_body: Indian MBBS student Shoaib Lone from Jammu and Kashmir, who was critically injured after an accident in Bangladesh's Dhaka, has been airlifted to Delhi. Jammu and Kashmir BJP president Ravinder Raina said that PM Narendra Modi personally called India's ambassador to Bangladesh to provide all necessary help to the student's family. Shoaib's father has thanked PM Modi.

363.title: Cong workers protest against Kerala CM in flight, LDF convenor pushes them
363.article_body: Two Youth Congress workers raised slogans against Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan when he was aboard a flight from Kannur to Thiruvananthapuram on Monday. They demanded Vijayan's resignation. Youth Congress State Vice-President KS Sabarinadhan shared a video of the incident and alleged that senior CPI(M) leader and LDF convenor EP Jayarajan pushed the protesting Congress workers.

364.title: Grateful that Owaisi shared jobs data in his speech: Varun Gandhi
364.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi thanked AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi for mentioning employment data shared by him that stated that over 60 lakh sanctioned central and state government posts lie vacant. "I'm grateful that my questions...were mentioned by Owaisi," Gandhi said. Gandhi had last month said that these statistics are startling when unemployment is at its highest level in three decades.

365.title: North-south cinema divide is stupid, I don't understand it: Nani
365.article_body: Telugu actor Nani has commented on the north-south cinema debate, saying that the divide is stupid and he doesn't understand it. "We are naming ourselves Bollywood, Tollywood, Kollywood; these are like borrowed names from Hollywood," the actor added. Nani further said, "I don't understand why we call ourselves different industries. The languages may be different but we are one nation."

366.title: Tribal clashes in Sudan's Darfur kill 100 in a week, says UN
366.article_body: Tribal clashes over the past week in Sudan's Darfur region have killed around 100 people, the UN refugee agency and a tribal elder said on Monday. The fighting grew out of a land dispute between Arab and African tribes, a senior UN official said. Local Arab militias then attacked multiple villages in the area, the official added.

367.title: Understand why jury favoured Johnny, he's a fantastic actor: Amber after losing trial
367.article_body: Actress Amber Heard in her first televised interview after losing the defamation trial against ex-husband Johnny Depp, said she 'didn't blame' the trial jury for siding with Depp. She said she understands why they sided with him, adding, "He's a beloved character and people feel they know him. He's a fantastic actor."

368.title: Rahul, Priyanka visit Sonia Gandhi at Delhi's Sir Ganga Ram Hospital
368.article_body: A day after Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi was admitted to Delhi's Sir Ganga Ram Hospital due to COVID-19-related complications, party leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Monday visited her in the facility. Party spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala had earlier said that Sonia's condition was stable and that she would be kept at the hospital for observation.

369.title: He has Ukrainian nationality: Father of Moroccan who fought in war
369.article_body: The father of a Moroccan-born man, Brahim Saadoun, sentenced to death by a court in Russia-backed Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) on mercenary charges, said that his son has Ukrainian nationality. Brahim should be treated as a "prisoner of war" for fighting in the Russia-Ukraine war, his father said. Brahim received Ukrainian nationality in 2020 after undergoing military training there.

370.title: You're my favourite sister's kid, you're forgiven: Govinda on Krushna's apology
370.article_body: After comedian, Krushna Abhishek appeared on Maniesh Paul’s podcast and apologised to his uncle Govinda, the latter accepted his apology. While addressing Krushna and his sister Arti on Maniesh's podcast, Govinda said, "You and Arti are my favourite sister's kids. I've got so much love from her...Do not let my behaviour be the reason for your sadness...You are always forgiven."

371.title: PM Modi, Shah walk around with ego & arrogance; won't last: Raj CM
371.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah walk around with ego, arrogance, adding that it hasn't worked for anyone and won't work for them either. He said that Congress leaders Rahul and Sonia Gandhi have shown that they won't compromise and will fight on the basis of ideology against them.

372.title: Algeria is increasingly aligning itself with Russia: Spain minister
372.article_body: Spanish minister Nadia Calvino has said that Algeria has increasingly aligned itself with Russia, adding that Algeria's decision to suspend friendship treaty with Spain isn't surprising. Algeria suspended the treaty with Spain over latter's change of stance on Western Sahara dispute. Notably, Spain is also member of EU and NATO, both of which have opposed Russian invasion of Ukraine.

373.title: Mumbai reports its 1st cases of BA.4 and BA.5 sub-variants of Omicron
373.article_body: Mumbai has reported three cases of the BA.4 and one case of the BA.5 sub-variants of coronavirus, according to the latest report from the Kasturba Hospital Laboratory Services. As per reports, all these patients have been cured in home isolation. Two of these patients are 11-year-old girls. Maharashtra reported 1,885 new COVID-19 cases on Monday.

374.title: Uday Kotak's son Jay shares pic of chaos at US airport, calls India better than US
374.article_body: Jay Kotak, billionaire Uday Kotak's son and Kotak 811 Co-head, shared a picture of chaos at US' Boston Airport after waiting in a five-hour line to check-in. "Mumbai airport handles MORE passengers than Boston. Yet, there are few lines...India works," he tweeted. Calling US a nation in decay, he said, "Flying to India feels like returning to a better place."

375.title: COVID-19 not over yet, increase vaccination for school kids: Mandaviya
375.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Monday said that the pandemic isn't over yet and stressed on being vigilant and observing COVID-19-appropriate behaviour. "Let us accelerate our efforts to identify all beneficiaries in the 12-17 age group for the first and second doses, so they can attend schools with the protection of the vaccine," he added.

376.title: Govt launches Startups for Railways, to grant up to ₹1.5 cr each to innovators
376.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Monday launched the Startups for Railways policy to provide an enabling platform for startups to partner with Indian Railways. Railways will provide funding support of up to ₹1.5 crore each to startups and entrepreneurs on matching contribution basis. Indian Railways CEO Vinay Kumar said they'll also hand-hold startups in scaling up prototype deployment.

377.title: Congress & corruption are made for each other: Union Minister Naqvi
377.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Monday alleged that Congress and corruption are made for each other, adding that Congress was carrying out "satyagraha for corruption". "The Congress has become a crew of corruption and a champion of converting corruption into revolution," BJP leader Naqvi said. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was questioned by the ED in a money laundering case.

378.title: Indigo airline transports heart from Vadodara to Mumbai in 2.5 hrs
378.article_body: IndiGo successfully transported a live organ, a donated heart, from Vadodara to Mumbai in under two-and-a-half hours last week, the airline revealed on Monday. The heart was successfully transplanted into a patient at a hospital in the city. "Every life is precious, and IndiGo appreciates the opportunity to have contributed to saving one," CEO Ronojoy Dutta said.

379.title: Over 150 people have made the score: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' composer
379.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' composer Tanuj Tiku has revealed that over 150 people, including 75 musicians from orchestra, were involved in creating the score for the Aamir Khan-starrer. He said, "We played live, jammed together and created the thematic music [in Panchgani]. Within two weeks...thematic material and character motifs were readied." Tanuj added the music for trailer was recorded in Budapest.

380.title: Delhi government to collaborate with Denmark to enhance groundwater recharge
380.article_body: Delhi government will explore possibilities of collaboration with Denmark in areas of groundwater recharge and power generation from stubble, the Delhi CM's office said on Monday. This comes after a delegation led by Ambassador of Denmark to India Freddy Svane met with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. "We want to make Delhi self-sustainable by...increasing the water table," Kejriwal said.

381.title: Woman security guard electrocuted in Hyderabad colony
381.article_body: A female security guard on Sunday was electrocuted at an under-construction building in Hyderabad. The victim, identified as Ganga, suffered instant shock after trying to plug the motor into a switchboard that hadn't been properly insulated. Her husband, Ketavath Suresh, who is employed at the same construction site, filed a complaint with the police and a case has been registered.

382.title: Maharashtra sees 1,885 new COVID-19 cases; active cases jumps 241% in 10 days
382.article_body: Maharashtra reported 1,885 new COVID-19 cases on Monday as compared to 1,803 cases recorded the previous day. The number of active cases has risen to 17,480, which is a jump of 241% from 5,127 cases reported on June 3. The state saw one death due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, according to the state health bulletin.

383.title: Disney-Pixar's 'Lightyear' banned in Saudi over same-sex kiss: Report
383.article_body: Disney-Pixar's animated film 'Lightyear' has been banned in Saudi Arabia over a same-sex kiss scene, reported The Hollywood Reporter. The scene was originally excluded but reinstated later after Pixar employees accused the studio of censoring "overtly gay affection". Earlier, Marvel's 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' and 'Eternals' were banned in Gulf countries over LGBTQ+ scenes.

384.title: Massive fire at scrap godown in Gurugram, 20 tenders rushed to spot
384.article_body: Several shanties and a scrap godown were gutted after a massive fire broke out in a Gurugram village post-midnight on Sunday. Fire department officials said at least 20 fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire and no casualties have been reported. The scrap godown had plastic material because of which the fire spread, an official said.

385.title: 100 terrorists killed in Kashmir this year so far: Officials
385.article_body: Security forces have killed 100 terrorists, including 29 foreigners, in Kashmir during counter-insurgency operations since the beginning of this year so far, officials said on Monday. Of these, 63 were members of Lashkar-e-Taiba terror group, they added. This is double the number of terrorists killed during the corresponding period last year, they further said.

386.title: We’re seeing England's greatest ever: Pope on teammate Root
386.article_body: Praising England batter Joe Root, teammate Ollie Pope said, "We're seeing England's greatest ever. You don't want to necessarily replicate what he does but try to learn as much as I can off of him." Root (176) scored his 27th Test century in ongoing second England-New Zealand Test, equalling India's Virat Kohli and Australia's Steve Smith's tally of Test centuries.

387.title: School bus drivers in Mumbai to hike charges by 20%
387.article_body: School bus operators in Mumbai said that they will raise the charges for ferrying students by at least 20% during the current academic year. This is due an increase in the price of fuel and various other factors, they added. Notably, parents of some students said that schools have not yet conveyed to them about the increase in bus charges.

388.title: Traffic policeman jumps in front of bus to save child who fell from e-rickshaw
388.article_body: An IAS officer has shared a video showing a traffic policeman save the life of a child, who had fallen from a moving e-rickshaw. The officer was purportedly seen swiftly crossing the road, picking the child and handing him over to a woman, who was travelling in the same vehicle. Twitter users have praised him for risking his own life.

389.title: Fame had bad impact on my health, my whole body was sick: Sandra Oh
389.article_body: Grey's Anatomy actor Sandra Oh said fame had a detrimental impact on her health. "My whole body was very...sick...It [was]...like...I can't sleep. Oh, my back hurts. I don't know what's wrong with my skin. I learnt that I've to take care of my health first," she added. Sandra said her work is much more demanding than some people may realise.

390.title: Played 3 games then got dropped for 7, came back again: Jaiswal on IPL 2022
390.article_body: Talking about his stint in IPL 2022, RR batter Yashasvi Jaiswal said, "I played three games, then I got dropped for seven games and then I came back again and started playing." The 20-year-old scored 258 runs in 10 matches in IPL 2022. Jaiswal, who plays for Mumbai in Ranji Trophy, scored his maiden First Class century against Uttarakhand recently.

391.title: Case against 22-yr-old for online post supporting BJP's Nupur Sharma
391.article_body: Maharashtra Police on Monday registered a case against a 22-year-old man for posting a message on social media supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. The accused had written "I support Nupur Sharma" on his Facebook status along with a message and a picture of the suspended BJP leader, an official said.

392.title: Man tosses ₹500 notes on Hyd street; investigation launched after video goes viral
392.article_body: A video showing a man tossing several ₹500 notes on a street in Hyderabad is going viral on social media. The man, who was accompanied by more people, threw the notes in the air reportedly during a 'baraat'. "Footages of the closed-circuit cameras are being checked to establish their identity. Suitable action will be initiated against them," police said.

393.title: Cong workers protest outside ED office in B'luru in Rahul's support
393.article_body: Congress workers in huge numbers gathered outside the ED office in Bengaluru as party leader Rahul Gandhi was summoned for questioning in connection with the National Herald case in Delhi. Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala shared pictures of the party workers on Twitter. "The cowardly Modi [government] can't suppress the voice," Surjewala said.

394.title: Rescue of Chhattisgarh boy stuck in borewell for 3 days to be delayed: CM
394.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday said the rescue operation of an 11-year-old boy, who fell into a borewell three days ago, will take some more time since a rock was found during tunnelling process. "The child has...eaten a banana at 5 am today," Baghel tweeted. Janjgir-Champa DM called the boy "determined" and said he's helping officials in his rescue.

395.title: Retail inflation eases to 7.04% in May from 8-year-high of 7.79% in April
395.article_body: India's retail inflation eased to 7.04% in the month of May, as compared to 7.79% in the previous month, data released by the government on Monday showed. This is the fifth consecutive month in which retail inflation has breached the RBI's upper margin of 6%. The CPI inflation of 7.79% recorded in April 2022 was the highest since May 2014.

396.title: B'luru hotel where Siddhanth detained for consuming drugs gets notice
396.article_body: The Bengaluru hotel where actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth Kapoor was detained during a police raid at a rave party has been given notice, police said. "We have asked specific questions, they will have to answer," said DCP East BS Guled. Siddhanth and five other persons have tested positive for drug usage, Bengaluru Police said.

397.title: Crypto market value slumps below $1 trillion for first time since Jan 2021
397.article_body: The value of cryptocurrency market on Monday fell below $1 trillion for the first time since January 2021, according to CoinMarketCap. The crypto market, which peaked at nearly $3 trillion in November 2021, has lost $1 trillion in value in the last two months alone. World's largest crypto Bitcoin was down over 10% on Monday, whereas Ethereum fell over 15%.

398.title: Lloyds Bank offers staff £1,000 to ease cost of living crisis: Report
398.article_body: Britain's Lloyds Bank on Monday told staff that it would give the vast majority of them a one-off £1,000 (about ₹95,000) payment to help combat the soaring cost of living, Reuters reported. The amount would reportedly be available in August and executives and senior managers have been exempted from the payout. The offer has been made to around 64,000 employees.

399.title: What's Google's LaMDA chatbot which allegedly 'behaved like a person'?
399.article_body: A senior Google engineer claimed that an AI chatbot developed by the tech giant gained sentience and was 'behaving like a person'. The LaMDA chatbot was first announced in 2021 and has the ability to have a "free-flowing" discussion on an "endless number of topics", as per Google. LaMDA can "unlock more natural ways of interacting with technology", said Google.

400.title: Was nervous before my IIFA 2022 performance; I danced after 6 yrs: Shahid
400.article_body: IIFA 2022's Instagram account shared a promo clip of the upcoming award telecast.  The video was of actor Shahid Kapoor before he performed at IIFA that took place in Abu Dhabi. In the video, he was heard saying, "I feel nervous, I'm dancing after 6 years." The actor also paid his tribute to the late music composer, Bappi Lahiri.
